texts.en:
Pedro, 28, is a young married man; he has a one year old son.  He lives with his family in San Juan Nepomuceno, a town in Bolívar Department, where he has a store where he sells snacks, foodstuffs, beverages and basic staple items every day for cash and in small amounts like families in the area request for their daily meals. 
 
His store opened in 2010 with just 10% of his current capital because he’s grown.  He’s located in a small, approximately 2 meters by 5 meters, locale.  His goal is to make his business grow and his greatest challenge is to have enough working capital to expand and better equip his store.

This is the reason for accessing a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he will use to buy building materials and supplies to expand the locale.  With his Kiva loan his possibility of obtaining a larger number of customers in a comfortable manner will increase and he will have more of the products that are best-sellers on hand which will increases sales levels and this is precisely what his investment’s success is based on.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a married woman with three children. Two of her children go to school. She also takes care of her mother. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and utilities.

To earn a living, she sells second-hand clothes at the market. She works six days a week, and she has been in this business for seven years. She explains that her major business challenges include seasonality and her customers' default rates.

She has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Prossy hopes to grow her business into a wholesale business so that she can start importing clothese from Mombasa.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 28-year-old, married man with one child.

Since 2009, Salah has owned and operated a shop where he sells mobile phones and phone accessories. He has experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for a "youth" loan in the amount of $2,400 in order to install an outdoor roof, to purchase a computer and an air conditioner. He is aiming to generate more profits so that he can provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to improve his business by installing a roof and purchasing a computer and air conditioner.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child, who is in the second grade. Her husband is a businessman, who supports her and her family. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She spends much of her income each month on rent and food.

For the last two years, Fatuma has been operating a tailoring business from her home. She dreams of opening a tailoring training college in the future. Fatuma is now seeking a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to purchase clothing materials and another sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing materials and another sewing machine.

loans.name: Sineno

texts.en:
Sineno is a married mother of two children, one of whom attends school while the other is too young for school.  She has rented a house that has electricity but not running water.

Sineno sells charcoal from her home and has been in this business for the past six months.  Her goal is to open a kiosk in the future.  High transportation costs are her major challenge.  

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to loans.  Sineno plans to use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nadia Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Nadia Parveen is a 30-year-old married woman with four children: two daughters and two sons. Her daughters are attending school while her sons are free and stay at home. 
Nadia herself is a housewife. She prefers staying at home and does household work. She has a set routine to get up early in the morning, ready her daughters for school, and prepare breakfast for her family. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 
Her husband is an electrician by profession. He offers electronics and electricity repairing services to the customers. He has been in this profession for the past 4 years and satisfies his customers through his good skills. 
Nadia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying the latest electricity repairing tools to provide better quality repairing services. Nadia is hopeful that with the latest repairing tools her husband will be able to provide services to many more customers and can generate a good income.

Note: One of the members has a sewing business. That's why she is showing it in the picture.

loans.use: To buy the latest electrical repair tools

loans.name: Ramazon

texts.ru: Рамазон на протяжении 30 лет занимается продажей женской бижутерии. Изделий из серебра таких серьги, кольца браслеты. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей. Жена занимается воспитанием детей  и уходом за хозяйством. В бизнесе ему помогает сын Фаридун. Кроме продажи изделий он также занимается частичным изготовлением изделий из серебра. Он оформляет изделия разными драгоценными камнями. Он хочет получить займ для пополнения товарооборота и приобретения сырья. Он надеется на помощь, так как летом у него сезон на его товар и большой спрос.
texts.en: Ramazon has been selling women's jewelry for some 30 years. He sells silver jewelry, such as earrings, rings, and bracelets. He is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker. His son Faridun helps him in the business. In addition to selling, Ramazon also makes some of the silver jewelry himself. He sets  various gemstones in silver mountings. He would like to obtain a loan to increase his stock and also buy raw materials. He hopes for your help since the summer is  a busy season for him, and his wares are in demand.

loans.use: to purchase  raw materials [for silver jewelry].

loans.name: Alyar

texts.en:
Alyar is a 50-year-old, married man with two children. He has been breeding livestock from a very young age, thanks to his father, who taught him the best breeding techniques. During his years of experience, Alyar has acquired a great deal of knowledge and skills required for the business. Now he has a large livestock farm.

He purchases lambs and calves in the central livestock market and raises them. After fattening the animals he resells them for profits at the livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan because people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. His explains that his business requires a lot of physical strength as Alyar spends most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him to feed the animals.

His monthly income is approximately 300 AZN, but Alyar wishes to increase his income in the future. As meat is in high demand, he needs more capital to put to his business and to reach the market. For this purpose he applied for a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN. He would use the loan proceeds to buy three cattle and fodder.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and animal feed

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es: Leyla  de 47 años, vive en la Ciudad de Cartagena de Indias,  con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 5 a 21 años. Allí tiene un salón de belleza donde ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen a todas las familias que la rodean. Su idea de negocio inició, cuando a los 16 años hizo un curso de peluquería por las noches y al mismo tiempo trabajaba de día, pues la profesora la contrató al ver su entusiasmo y su capacidad de aplicar lo aprendido, logrando así una gran experiencia, que tiempo después capitalizó en un negocio, como hoy lo tiene. Ella empezó comprando con sus propios ingresos,  las herramientas de trabajo y continuó actualizándose en el tema de belleza, por eso poco a poco amplió sus posibilidades de crecimiento, comprando enseres para organizar un punto de atención; su ganas de avanzar le facilitó el tener una academia y ofrecía clases; posteriormente se hizo reconocida y consiguió un trabajo en el que tenia que viajar frecuentemente, por eso cambió su negocio por un buen empleo, pero 5 años después regresó a su inicial idea, la de tener su propio negocio. Con este  le ha ido muy bien y simultáneamente genera ingresos por la venta de mercancías, especialmente las asociadas a la belleza, así ella asesora y vende productos cosméticos y capilares al mismo tiempo y esto es lo que más le gusta a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará tratamientos capilares y productos cosméticos, así como una vitrina para mantener bien ordenado su inventario. El éxito de su credikiva es su gran experiencia y el logro de disminuir sus costos, comprando de contado y en mayor volumen y justamente eso es lo que persigue Leyla.
texts.en:
Leyla, 47, lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 5 to 21 years.  She has a beauty salon here where she offers image improvement services to all surrounding families.  The idea for her business arose when she took a barber course at night at the age of 16 while working days because her teacher hired her when she saw her enthusiasm and ability to apply what she learned.  She acquired vast experience this way which in time she capitalized into her business like she has to this day.

She started out buying work tools with her own income and continued updating in beauty topics so was able to gradually expand her growth possibility buying furnishings to equip her salon. Her drive to make progress led to her opening an academy and she taught courses becoming well-known later on.  She then got a job that required her to travel frequently so she swapped her business for a good job but five years after that she returned to her original idea of having her own business.  She’s done very well with this one and she also generates income selling merchandise, especially beauty-associated goods.  She is a cosmetics and hair-treatments advisor and saleswoman and this is what her customers like best.

She is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will use to buy hair treatments and cosmetics as well as a display case to keep her inventory well organized.  The success of her Kiva loan is her vast experience and diminished costs by paying cash and in large volume and this is precisely what Leyla is going after.

loans.use: to buy supplies, equipment and a display case for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Saida

texts.es:
La socia Saida nació en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia del Cusco del departamento de Cusco pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Desde muy niña se vino a vivir a la ciudad del Cusco y donde termino de estudiar la secundaria. La socia Saida tiene 21 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. la socia Saida y su esposo se dedican al transporte, ella es la administradora del negocio y él es el chofer, él brinda  servicio de transporte en su propio carro en la ciudad de Calca hacia la ciudad de lares y viceversa, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro desea comprar lubricantes, aceites y otras cosas más. 

La socia Saida pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Adelante” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Saida was born in the city of Calca in the province of Cusco, but now lives in the city of Cusco.  When she was young she came to live in the city of Cusco and that is where she finished secondary school.  Saida is 21 years old, she is married by common law, and she has one child. 

Saida and her husband are in the transportation business.  She is the business manager and her husband is the chauffeur.  He provides transportation services in his own car from the city of Calca to the city of Lares and back.  Saida is asking for a loan so that she can perform maintenance on the car.  She needs to buy lubricants, oils, and other items.

Saida is a member of the community bank "Siempre Adelante" in the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her car.  She needs to buy lubricants, oils and other items.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 30-year-old single Lebanese woman living with her parents and four siblings. Three of them are working. Her father is the one responsible for providing for their needs. Even so, they are all unified, depending on each other and grateful for what god has given them. Nada has owned a lingerie shop since 2002. Today, she wants to borrow a youth loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to enlarge her shop and buy additional lingerie in order to earn better income. In the future, she plans to open new branches in different areas.

loans.use: to enlarge her shop and buy additional lingerie.

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar is a 40-year-old man who is married and has two sons. He is a market vendor and sells potatoes, onions, and other seasonal vegetables in his wholesale market. He has ten years of experience in this field. He rents a car to drive around the villages and buy fresh potatoes and onions from local farmers which he then sells for a profit. He usually makes this gathering twice a month.

His business brings him a stable income of AZN 250 and this is the only source of income for his family. Fresh and organic vegetables are very popular among local people and Bakhtiyar always chooses the best to sell.

He applied for a loan of AZN 1500 to purchase more vegetables to sell as it is summertime and people use fresh vegetables almost every day. This will be his third loan and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling fish for the past six years. Mwanakombo owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. In addition, she owns some rental houses which provide her with another source of income. She aspires to own several rental houses. She describes seasonality as her major challenge, and food and school fees as her greatest monthly expenses. 
Mwanakombo plans to purchase cement and sand to renovate her rental houses with the loan of Ksh 40,000.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes   es una mujer que tiene 62 años de edad, de estado civil casada, sin ningún  hijo a su cargo, vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Mercedes vive en  el caserío Santa Isabel, distrito de Mòrrope, departamento de Lambayeque, así mismo cuentan con  todos los  servicio  básico;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Mercedes es la crianza/venta de porcinos, caprinos y  aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Mercedes cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge  le apoyan en esta actividad.
Actualmente Mercedes se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/ 2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la  compra de alimentos balanceados y mejoras de corrales, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 62 year old married woman with no children.  She lives in a home of her own with her husband.  Most of the community residents are independent workers who sell and raise small animals and a few of them also farm.  Mercedes lives in the Santa Isabel settlement, within the Mòrrope zone and the Lambayeque department.  They have all of the basic services.  All of the families living there live under the same conditions.

Mercedes raises and sells pigs, goats, and corral birds.  She raises the animals in the area outside her home and has been doing this for five years, allowing her to keep her established customers in this business.  She sells her animals to large businesses in the zone.  Her husband supports her activities.

Currently Mercedes has proposed expanding her inventory for buying and selling animals, since this is a very profitable business in her zone.  For this reason she requested a new loan of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use to buy balanced feed and better animal pens.  This will eventually allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and animal pens.

loans.name: Mehassan

texts.en: Mehassan is a divorced woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She operates a fish selling business and has been in this business for the last ten years, selling at the market to the general public. She aspires to be the best supplier of fish in the region. Mehassan lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and school fees. She joined Yehu because of their good products. With the loan of KES 20,000, she intends to buy stock of fish and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 35-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and four children. He’s trying the best he can to cover his family's expenses. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1999, independently responding to customer's requests. Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new car. In that way, he will be capable of carrying on with his business in the proper way without facing problems. In the future, he plans to buy a minivan in order to transport more people.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim is 30 years old.  He is married and has one son.  He used to work as taxi driver but his salary was too low, so he started his own business.  For the past two years, he has been selling mobile phones and accessories in his shop.  He earns a monthly income of 200 AZN. 

He has applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN to expand his business and purchase more merchandise.  Mobile phones are very popular and Karim wishes to diversify his inventory of phones to meet market demand.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones and diversify his range of merchandise.

loans.name: Karla Jesennia

texts.es: Karla es una mujer dedicada a sus hijas quienes son estudiantes. Sus proyectos siempre se han trazado en la construccion de su vivienda pues considera ser la mejor herencia que les pueda otorgar a sus dos pequeñas. Actualmente labora como domestica trabajo de mucho desgaste fisico, sin embargo su salario no le da para que de una vez por completo ella junto a su familia gocen de mejores comodidades, es por ello el motivo que acude una vez mas a la micro-financiera siendo este su decimo ciclo de credito se propone comprar hierro, laminas de zinc, bloques, cemento, clavos, madera, arena, alambre de amarre, piedrin entre otros materiales y asi empezar a levantar totalmente su casa de concreto. Su esposo quien es taxista le ayuda a cubrir gastos del hogar por lo que se siente apoyada ya que se puede equilibrar tanto con sus compromisos de pago como con las obligaciones del hogar.
texts.en:
Karla is a woman dedicated to her daughters who are students.  Her projects have always been focused on the construction of her home because she considers that to be the best inheritance that she can leave for her two small children.  

Karla is a domestic worker and does a lot of physical work; however, her salary does not provide her the equivalent of full-time wages.  In order for Karla and her family to enjoy better amenities, she is once again seeking a micro-finance loan, which will be her tenth loan.  

She needs to buy iron, zinc sheets, concrete blocks, cement, nails, wood, sand, tie wire, gravel, and other materials so that she can begin to completely rebuild her concrete home.  Her husband is a taxi driver and helps cover the household expenses.  He feels he can balance both his obligations to the family and to re-building their home.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. She owns a cosmetics shop where she sells her goods to the general public. Rita lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She aspires to open a salon in the future, and she describes that her greatest monthly expenses are rent, food and school fees.  Her other sources of livelihood include earnings from the husband. With this KSH 20000 loan, she plans to purchase cosmetics to resell.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Felix Gerardo

texts.es:
Felix es un joven muy trabajador, es padre de un pequeño al cual quiere mucho y sobre todo por el que trabaja con tal de darle lo mejor y que sea feliz; su vivienda se encuentra en el distrito de Parcona, este distrito se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, así como también en el se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Cuando Felix tiene un tiempo libre le gusta leer un libro y también aprovecha la oportunidad para disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Derecho.

Día a Día Felix sale a trabajar en su negocio como carpintero, mayormente realiza trabajos de tapicería de sillas  y también arregla zapatos, él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 6 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene mucha creatividad.

Felix está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar 
material para la realización de su trabajo como tela, cola, herramientas, clavos, esponja, entre otros, así el poder tener lo necesario para realizar su trabajo y así mismo seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder darle a su hijo una buena educación y ser feliz”.
texts.en:
Felix is a very hard working young man. He has one small son whom he loves very much and above all he is the reason he works hard, so that he can give him the best and so that he will be happy. His house is located in the district of Parcona; an area known for having a hot climate, and for being an area known for agriculture and livestock. During his free time Felix likes to read and to take advantage of the opportunity to enjoy one of his favorite Peruvian foods, Arroz con Pato (rice with duck). He was only able to study through junior high, but he would have liked to have studied law. 

Everyday Felix goes to work in his carpentry business. The majority of the jobs he has are upholstering chairs and also fixing shoes. He usually works around 10 hours a day and helps an average of 6 customers during this time. He believes his business is doing well because he is very nice to his customers and above all because he is creative.    

Felix is very thankful to the lenders on Kiva; thanks to the help they have given he will be able to buy materials to be able to do his work, like fabric, glue, tools, nails, sponge and other things. With these purchases he will be able to complete his work and continue working to make his biggest dream come true, to be able to give his son a good education and a happy life.

loans.use: to buy sponge, glue, nails, tools, fabric and other things.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a married business lady and runs a retail shop which has been in operation for two years. She received a loan from her father to start the business.
She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase rice, detergents and cereals. She aspires to open other outlets in the near future and believes that the extra income obtained from this loan will help her educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase rice, detergents and cereals.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a mother of four children who are all in school. She is married to a business man and they live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. 

For the last six years, Mishi has been operating a shop selling foodstuff to her neighbors. High transport cost and theft of goods are her major challenges. She dreams of expanding the shop to a wholesale business and hire employees.  

Mishi joined Yehu because of their good products. Other sources of her family's livelihood include earnings from her spouse. With this loan of KSH 50,000, she will be able to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar to resell.

loans.use: buy flour, rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a mother married to a business man. She has four children who are in school. She has been selling clothes in a shop for the past four years, and she aims at opening a wholesale business in the future. Grace sells her clothes to the general public and describes seasonality to be her major challenge.  She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She spends most of her income on food, rent and school fees. Grace plans to use the loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos pero uno de ellos falleció, su hijo aun vive con ella tiene 19 años de edad y  estudian en la universidad. Su esposo trabaja en el municipio del cantón.

Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, así como también productos de bazar, de papelería y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), productos que vende en su misma tienda, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y esposo le ayudan más que todo en las noches cuando están desocupados, ella lleva tres años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres, artículos de bazar, papelería y productos Avon. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 12 años,  es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos instalo su negocio.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo con tienda.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Nuevos Horizontes" (New Horizons) meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Martha. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children, but one of them is deceased. Her other child, age 19, still lives with her and is a university student. Her husband works for the municipal government within the canton.

Martha has a general store in her home where she sells all types of basic necessity products. She also offers bazaar products, stationery, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories), which are also sold in her store. Martha works every day from 6am to 8pm, and sometimes much later. Her son and her husband help out mostly in the evenings when they are not busy. Martha has been in this business for three years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to restock her business. She will buy provisions, bazaar products, stationery, and Avon products. Martha has been with her Communal Bank for 12 years and also serves as the treasurer of her group. She enjoys being a member because the loans were responsible for establishing her business. Her goal is to continue growing her store.

loans.use: to buy provisions, bazaar products, stationery, and Avon products.

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
Este comité se llama” Espíritu Santo “están en el decimo segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya. Ellas son mujeres muy luchadoras y es por eso que son muy reconocidas en su barrio, su inspiración son sus familiares, es por ellos que siempre luchan y se esfuerzan.
Daisy es una de estas mujeres, ella con la ayuda de su grupo y también sumado a su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Comenta que tiene una peluquería en la que atiene a todos sus clientes. Daisy se ha hecho de buena fama, ya que siempre da muy buena atención y tampoco es muy caro.
Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su peluquería y es por eso que pide un crédito a Kiva y a la fundación paraguaya, para la compra de spray, tijeras, juegos de peines, ruleros, tintes y otros, ya que estos son los productos que mas usa y le serán muy utiles.
texts.en:
This committee, called "Espíritu Santo" [Holy Spirit], is in the twelfth cycle of the Fundación Paraguaya program for women entrepreneurs.  The women are real fighters and because of this they are well known in their neighborhood.  Their inspiration is their families; it is for them that they always fight and put forth effort.  

Daisy is one of these women.  She, with the help of her group and also in addition to her own efforts, is flourishing.  She says that she has a salon in which she attends to all of her customers.  Daisy has made a good reputation for herself since she always gives close attention and is not very expensive.  

She wants to continue investing in her salon and it is for this reason that she asks Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya for a loan to purchase [hair] spray, scissors, comb sets, curlers, dyes and other items since these are the most used products and they will be very helpful.

loans.use: to purchase [hair] spray, scissors, comb sets, curlers, dyes and other items.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo  es un hombre que tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con tres hijos a su cargo, vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Oswaldo vive en  el caserío CP-10, distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura, así mismo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de una pileta comunal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Oswaldo es la crianza/venta de  aves de corral, caprinos, porcinos,ovinos; la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Oswaldo cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; el vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo  también se dedica a la agricultura como una actividad complementaria donde tiene instalado 0.5 ha, de limón donde viene cosechando semanalmente y esto le permite tener otros ingresos adicionales, su cónyuge también  le apoyan en esta actividad.
Actualmente Oswaldo se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/ 500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la  compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde y mantenimiento de su cultivo instalado, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is a 40 year old man, he is married by common law, he has three dependent children, and he lives in his own home with his spouse and children.  It's important to highlight that the quality of life in his community is at the subsistence level.  The majority of the residents are independent workers that breed, raise and sell livestock, and some are additionally involved in agriculture.  Oswaldo lives in the neighborhood CP-10 in the district of Tambogrande, department of Piura, where the electrical and water services are provided through a communal pool. Therefore, all of the families there live in poor economic conditions.

Oswaldo raises and sells poultry, goats, pigs, and sheep.  He raises these animals in pens in the yard outside his home.  It is noteworthy that Oswaldo has 5 years of experience in this activity, which has enabled him to maintain his customer base and to establish himself in this business.  He sells his animals to wholesalers in the region.  He also works in agriculture as a complimentary business and he has installed 0.5 hectares of lemon trees where weekly harvests provide him additional income.  His spouse helps in this activity.

Oswaldo has proposed to expand his inventory in the raising and sales of livestock, which is a very profitable activity in the region.  He is seeking a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 nuevos soles, which will be used for the purchase of feed for fattening his livestock and cultivating his crops, which in time will enable him to improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: the purchase of feed for fattening his livestock and cultivating his crops.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has five children, three are going to school. She has two additional family members (sister and brother). Margaret sells cereals (ground nuts and beans) at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 4 years. 

Margaret has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of ground nuts and beans.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Margaret aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business, and to own a delivery van to ease in transportation. She would also like to buy a plot of land to build rental rooms.  

Margaret lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy ground nuts and beans

loans.name: Mwaidi

texts.en: Mwaidi is a woman with three school-attending children. She operates a tailoring business, making and selling dresses to the general public. In addition, she also operates a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. Mwaidi rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She dreams of buying another motorcycle to increase her profits. Lack of honesty in her hired motorcycle employee is her major challenge for her motorcycle business. She spends most on school fees, rent and food each month. With the loan of Ksh 20000, she will be able to service her motorcycle.

loans.use: service her motorcycle

loans.name: Qorilazo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa ella es casada y tiene 52 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de maíz, ella vende maíz en forma ambulatoria, la socia lleva maíz a las diferentes lugares donde venden chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de papa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Qorilazo communal bank.  The bank is in the Cusco district, province, and department.

Tomasa, age 52, is married and has two children.  She works in her business of selling corn in an itinerant manner.   She takes the corn to the different places where “chicha” , which is a corn based drink, is sold.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  It is through this work that she gets her children ahead.  Her dream is to have a place where she can sell the corn.

She is requesting the loan to buy corn wholesale.

The other members devote themselves to the restaurant business, the business of selling food, the business of raising animals, the business of a grocery store, and the business of selling potatoes.

She is grateful to those who are part of this dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en: Mwanalima is a married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She operates a grocery where she sells her goods from home, mostly to her neighbors. Mwanalima has been operating this business for the last three years and she aspires to open a kiosk in the future. She faces a challenge of market competition and describes food and school fees to be her greatest monthly expenses. With the Ksh 20000 loan, she will be able to purchase onions, tomatoes, fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.use: buy onions, tomatoes, fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is 42 years old. He lives in a small village in Baghdati District, West Georgia with his family: wife – Eka, 21 years old daughter, 17-year-old son, and parents (pensioners). Kakha is a construction worker. He mainly works on private orders in his district. His daughter is a student and his son goes to school.  Eka is a housewife and is actively involved in the family's agricultural business. They have 0.6 hectare of land and a small vineyard. Kakha produces wine and vodka and sells them in the village. Along with the above mentioned, the family has a small pig farm with 2 pigs and piglets. Kakha and Eka sell on average 15 piglets in the village per year. The total average monthly income for the family is 600 Laris, including the pensions of Kakha’s parents. 

Kakha requested credit to rent a tractor for tilling the land and to purchase fertilizers. After tilling and fertilizing the land, Kakha will use it for vegetables growing. After properly doing the seasonal work, the family can count on a good harvest of vegetables. Kakha will sell them locally to greengrocery retailers. The family will get additional income and use it for financing the education of their children.

loans.use: rent a tractor to till his land and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Lidia Virginia

texts.es: La señora lidia Virginia tiene su venta de tortilla en el  mercado, tiene doce años de trabajar en  este negocio su actividad inicia  a las 7 de la mañana  y se retira del negocio a 12 del mediodía,  lidia agradece a ceprodel por que con los prestamos que ha adquirido con nuestra institución ha podido crecer en su negocio por que   en cada financiamiento va aumentando su inventario ya que ahora vende nacatamales sábado y domingo, agua purificada , este préstamo lo solicita para la compra de una cocina  y maíz , ya que tiene mucha demanda y  esto le será de mucho beneficio para brindar un mejor servicio a  sus  clientes.
texts.en:
Lidia Virginia sells tortillas in the market; she has been in this business for twelve years. Lidia works from 7 in the morning until 12 in the afternoon. She is grateful to Ceprodel because the loans she has received have allowed her to grow her business -- with every financing round she has been able to increase her inventory and now also sells nacatamales (a Nicaraguan dish similar to tamales) and bottled water Saturday and Sunday.

Lidia is seeking a loan in order to purchase a stove and a supply of corn which will allow her to meet the growing demand and give her clients a better service.

loans.use: To purchase a stove and a supply of corn

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a mother of five children, three of whom are in school. She has been operating a food stall from her home for the past five years, and she dreams of opening a hotel in the future. Mwanamisi’s primary customers are her neighbors. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  With this loan of Ksh 10000, she plans to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and beans to sell.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and beans

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en: Abdalla is a father of two children, both of whom are attending school. He has been operating a barber shop and a video filming business for the last five years, which are located at the market. He joined Yehu to get loans to boost his businesses. Abdalla lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.  He describes food to be his greatest monthly expense. With the loan of Ksh 50000, he will be able to repair his video hall and buy some benches.

loans.use: repair his video hall and buy benches

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a married woman who operates a food stall.  She has been operating it for the last 10 years, selling at the market. She describes market competition to be her major challenge. Fatuma lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenditure is food for the family. Other source of her income includes earnings from her children who are working. With the loan of Ksh 20000, she plans to purchase wheat flour, beans, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: purchase wheat flour, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is from Vani District, West Georgia. She is 37 years old, married and lives with her family: husband – George, two daughters (17 and 12 years old) and mother-in-law (pensioner). The children go to school. 

Natela and George lead the agricultural business for the family, which is the only source of the income for them. Natela is busy with the family-owned dairy farm which has 6 milk cows. Natela produces on average 100 kg of cheese and sells it on the local open market. She takes the cheese to the market 3-4 days a week. George helps Natela and also works in the family-owned vineyard  which has 1000 wine trees. He produces wine and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income for the family is 500 Laris. 

Natela requested credit to purchase a tractor. With it, George will provide various agricultural services mainly tilling to local farmers. He will be paid for this services and the family will get additional income. With the increased income, Natela will be able to save some funds to finance her daughters’ education.

loans.use: purchase a tractor

loans.name: Merashidi

texts.en: Merashidi is a widowed woman with five children, all adults. She operates a retail shop and has been doing so for the past five years. Merashidi dreams of expanding the shop to wholesale in the future. She describes price fluctuation to be her major drawback. Other sources of income include earnings from her children. She joined Yehu to get funds to boost her business. Merashidi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She intends to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, beans and sugar with the loan of Ksh 35,000.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a woman of three school-going children.  She lives in her own house which has electricity but no piped water. She has been operating a tailoring business for the last four years and dreams of expanding the business and hire an employee in the future. Other sources of her income include earnings from her spouse.  Fatuma makes dresses and sells them to her neighbors and to the entire public. This Ksh 20000 loan requested will help her purchase clothing materials.

loans.use: purchase clothing materials

loans.name: Mema Group

texts.en:
Edius, who is in his mid 30s, is married and has two children, one of them goes to school.  He has been running a fruits and vegetables business for four years now.  He works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Edius' 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase on the stock of his business and pay household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully.  Now he wants a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell.  His dream is to one day buy a piece of land and build his own house.

Edius will share this loan with his loan group "Mema", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Mwanakonze

texts.en: Mwanakonze is a married woman with three children, all adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has been operating a food stall for the past ten years where she sells her goods at the market, mostly to the market attendants. She describes price fluctuations as her major drawback, and she dreams of opening a hotel in the future. Her other sources of income include earnings from her rental house and those from her children. With the loan of Ksh 35000, she will be able to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a single lady who has been operating a cosmetics shop for the past four years. In addition, she also operates a salon. Both businesses are located at the market centre. Fatuma aspires to open a book shop in future and she describes lack of enough capital to run both businesses to be her major challenge. She lives in a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Fatuma joined Yehu to get access to loans. She plans to use the loan of Ksh 50000 to purchase cosmetics to resell.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a mother of four, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the last 10 years, she has been operating a salon which is located at the market centre. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations of goods. Her children provide her with help for her livelihood. She joined Yehu to get loans to expand her salon. Asha aspires to open a cosmetics shop. She plans to purchase cosmetics and other beauty items for her salon using the loan of Ksh 20,000.

loans.use: buy beauty items for her salon

loans.name: Juntos Unidos Iremos Al Camino Del Exito Group

texts.es: Claudia de 42 años de edad pertenece a la alcancia comunal "Juntos Iremos al Camino del Exito, un grupo de 10 integrantes  que se caracteriza por el empeño y la dedicacion en sus negocios con un solo objetivo que es salir adelante por el bien de sus familias. Claudia tiene un hijo menor de edad por lo cual se da tiempo entre cuidarlo y poder  trabajar en la venta de accesorios para automoviles y tambien vender diversos productos por campañas, lleva ya mas de 12 años en este negocio que inicio con su hermana a raiz de que no habian  suficientes ingresos para sustentar su hogar, ella viaja constantemente fuera de la ciudad a vender sus productos. Con este trabajo a podido lograr solventar gastos que cubren pagos como los del colegio de su hijo, el alquiler de su casa y gastos para su hogar. En el futuro le gustaria establecerse y poner una tienda propia para estar mas estable y con menos horas de trabajo para poder pasar mas tiempo con su hijo. El reciente prestamo lo piensa invertir en diversos productos para la campaña del dia de la madre y preparase para las ventas de las fiestas patrias.
texts.en:
Claudia, 42, belongs to Juntos Iremos al Camino del Éxito Communal Bank, a group of 10 members known for effort and determination in their businesses.  Their lone objective is to get ahead for the good of their families.

Claudia has a minor son, so she divides her time between caring for him and being able to work selling automotive accessories.  She also sells seasonal products.  She has had this business for more than 12 years.  She started it with her sister because there was not enough income to support the household.  She constantly travels outside the city to sell her products.

With this job she has been able to pay off expenses, such as payments for her son's school, the rent, and household expenses.  In the future she would like to get settled and set up her own store to be more stable and work fewer hours, to be able to spend more time with her son.

She plans to invest the recent loan in seasonal products for Mother's Day and prepare herself for sales for the national holiday.

loans.use: to invest in seasonal products for Mother's Day.

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es: Cesar padre de familia, hombre luchador, de buenos principios. Su principal prioridad ha sido el bienestar de su familia en especifico el de sus hijos quienes son pequeños y necesitan de su ayuda. Es por ello la motivacion que le impulsa a solicitar una vez mas el apoyo de Afodenic y kiva mismo apoyo que le servira para reforzar la seguridad e higiene de los suyos. Tiene como oficio el ser albañil, por lo que se siente muy complacido ya que se ahorrara la mano de obra. Con el credito lo que se propone es la instalacion de servicios higienicos e inicio de muro perimetral comprando asi con esta inversion los siguientes materiales de construccion; tuberia, cemento, arena, piedrin, bloques, hierro, arena,alambre de amarre, inodoro entre otros. En donde esta contento por que le sera posible ver mejoras en su vivienda y asi contribuir al bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is a parent and a tenacious man with fine principles.  His primary priority has been the well-being of his family.  Specifically, his children are his priority because they are young and need his help.

That is the motivation that drives him to request support from Afodenic and Kiva once again.  This support has served him to reinforce the security and hygiene of his loved ones.

He is a bricklayer by trade.  This makes him very happy because he will save the labor costs.  He plans to use the loan to install bathroom facilities and to start a perimeter wall.  He will buy the following construction materials:  pipes, cement, sand, gravel, cement blocks, iron, wire ties, and a toilet, among others.  He is happy because it will be possible to see improvements in his home, and this contributes to his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to install bathroom facilities and to start a perimeter wall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Blue Group

texts.en:
Loisa, who is a widow, has five children who go to school.  She has been running several businesses.  She does catering as well as sells charcoal and vegetables since 2008.  She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Loisa's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy food stock for her catering business.  She started selling charcoal and vegetables to help pay school fees and household expenses, and has repaid all her loans successfully.  She now wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Loisa will share this loan with her loan group "Blue", which has a total of 21 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: El Futuro 2 Group

texts.en:
Grey is the coordinator of her group El Futuro (The Future) 2. Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their three children.

Grey is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She runs a sales business where she sells miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women accessories and many other products. This loan will allow her to increase her business inventory. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business.

Grey said that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business and improve it.  She wants to have a little store to sells all her products. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy various products to resell

loans.name: Rawfish Group

texts.en:
Hannah is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Hannah was born in Kenema city twenty-five years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has three children attending primary and secondary schools.

For ten years now, Hannah has been selling fish. This is the first loan that Hannah and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Hannah will use her share of the loan to expand her business, she will buy a carton of fish to add to her current ones.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Wan Word Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Wan Word” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fereh.  Fereh is thirty-six years old.  She was born in Kenema city where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Fereh has been be a businesswoman for twenty years now. Currently, she is selling dried/smoked fish. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy baskets of dried/smoked fish to add to her business.

loans.use: buy dried/smoked fish to resell

loans.name: The Tamaraneh United Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of “The Tamaraneh United” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 1,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Abibatu is the leader of this group. This thirty-year-old is married to a businessman and they have three children. Abibatu has been a businesswoman for many years now, she is currently selling shoes. With her share of this loan, she will buy dozens of shoes (slippers) at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married and has eight children. He has received schooling through to form 4. Francis sells firewood and produces charcoal to sell in Asebu Brebia, which he has done for five years now. His wife is a trader. Francis uses his income to pay for his children’s school fees. 

Francis will use the loan to purchase acacia wood for the the production of the charcoal and firewood he sells. With the new profits, Francis hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase acacia wood to produce charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIOLETAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Yovana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de dulces, tejido de guantes, tejido de mantas de de vicuña, venta de tarjetas, atención de punto VIVA, venta de ropa.

La señora Yovana,  indica que hace un año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de productos por temporada de que viene trabajando hace tres años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra guantes, mismo que venderá hasta que pase la temporada de frío en nuestro departamento. Ella nos cuenta que el negocio que realiza lo desarrolla todos los días en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, ya que el mismo le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.

En la fotografía podemos observar que una de las socias se encuentra en el fondo y solo aparese media cabeza de ella, esto pasó porque no se ubico bien.
texts.en:
The Violetas communal bank will begin its second loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Regional Office.  It is made up of eight members and is governed by a board of directors headed by Yovana.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied, among which are: food sales, candy sales, knitting gloves, knitting vicuna blankets, card sales, Punto VIVA services [telephone, internet, photocopying], and clothing sales.

Yovana indicates that she has been a member of a communal bank in Pro Mujer for a year, joining on the invitation of the facilitator.  Currently she has a business selling seasonal products that she has been working in for three years.

The loan she will get now is to buy gloves that she will sell until the end of the cold season in our department.  She tells us that she carries out her business every day in the markets in the city of El Alto.  It helps her support her family, because she is married and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responds that she likes everything.

In the photograph you can see that one of the members is in the back and only half of her head appears; this happened because she was not well located.

loans.use: to buy gloves.

loans.name: Oscar Bonifacio

texts.es:
Oscar   es un hombre que tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, sin  hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Oscar vive en  el caserío Valle San Juan del distrito de Tambogrande y departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artezanal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Oscar es la crianza/venta de ganado porcinos  y aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Oscar cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo también esta dedicado a la agricultura donde tiene instalado 0.6 ha. De cultivo de limón donde   le permite tener otro ingresos
Actualmente Oscar se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.2500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra 0.5 has de terreno agrícola, cliente cuenta con el 50% del valor del terreno, esto con la finalidad de ampliar su frontera agrícola; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 45-year-old gentleman who is single and has no dependent children. He lives in his own home along with his partner. It should be mentioned that the quality of life in his community is subsistent. Most of the residents are independent workers who engage in trade and the breeding of small animals. Some of them also engage in agriculture. Oscar lives in the village of Valle San Juan in the District of Tambogrande, Department of Piura. The only basic service available in this area is electricity and the drinking water comes from an artesian well. All of the families that reside here must live under these conditions.

Oscar's business involves raising and selling pigs and poultry. The animals are kept in pens just outside of his home. Oscar has 10 years of experience in this business and has been able to maintain an established customer base. He sells the animals to wholesale traders in the area. In addition, Oscar is a farmer and has 0.6 hectares of land that produces limes so that he can earn additional income.

At the moment, Oscar proposes to expand his inventory in terms of raising and selling animals since this type of business is very profitable in this area. Under these circumstance he is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,500 PEN to invest in the purchase of another 0.5 hectares of farmland. He already has 50% of the land's purchase value. This will enable him to expand the boundary of his farm so that he can improve his standard of living over time.

loans.use: to buy farmland.

loans.name: Clara Pilar

texts.es: Clara tiene 52 años. Está casada con Hugo quien es maestro albañil. Desde hace 22 años viven en La Libertad  donde tienen su casa propia. Desde que recuerda se ha dedicado a la venta de artículos para el hogar, aun continua con el negocio porque se siente útil y le genera ganancias. La venta la realiza de lunes a sábado con su hijo cuando no está en la escuela. Carlita nos comenta que todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y tiene familia propia. El niño que actualmente están criando lo adoptaron y se ha convertido en su motor de vida. Con el préstamo va a comprar sabanas, toallas y cobijas para la venta. Su meta es seguir trabajando para apoyar a su hijo en los estudios.
texts.en: Clara is 52 years old. She is married to Hugo, who is a master bricklayer. For 22 years they have lived in La Libertad, where they own a house. For as long as she remembers, Clara has worked selling items for the home, a job she will carry on doing as it makes her feel useful and generates an income. She sells from Monday to Saturday, helped by her son when he's not in school. Clara tells us that all her own children are grown up and have families of their own, but she and her husband are currently raising a boy who they adopted, and he has become the driving force of her life. With the loan, she will buy sheets, towels and bedding to sell. Her goal is to carry on working to be able to support her son in his studies.

loans.use: to buy sheets, towels and bedding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to launch a marketing campaign to promote her business' new location.

loans.name: Hope To God Ii Group

texts.en:
Mahawa is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mahawa was born in Bo city twenty-nine years ago. Mahawa is married and the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Mahawa sells onions, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Mahawa and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mahawa will use her share of the loan (800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL)) to buy onions, Maggi, salt, pepper, etc. to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy food items to resell

loans.name: El Futuro 3 Group

texts.en:
Ramonita is the coordinator of her group El Futuro (The Future) 3. This group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here with her five children. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to educate and take care of her children while she is working to pay for all they need (food, clothes, etc.). She enjoys to be at home with her children after work and school.

Ramonita is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying a large variety of clothes and shoes. She runs her business by walking in her community and in other communities nearby. She is Haitian and is a single mother.  Ramonita's profits is the only income for her family's survival. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Love And Unity Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Love And Unity” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Binata is the leader of this group. This thirty-five-year-old is married to a trader and the couple has two children attending primary and secondary school. Binta has been a businesswoman for many years now, she sells palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil). With her share of this loan, she will buy the gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to resell

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en: Rakia is into gari production.  Gari is made out of cassava.  Rakia sells the gari at Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for 20 years now. She is married to a farmer and has 4 children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accommodations and utility bills. Rakia will use her loan to purchase cassava to produce her gari to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy cassava to make gari to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is single and has five children. She has completed junior high school. As a single parent, she is responsible for feeding, clothing and paying her children’s school fees. 
Sarah sells cooking utensils, saucepans and bowls at Asebu Brebia. She has been in this business for the past five years. She will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils and bowls for resale. She hope to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils and bowls for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widow and has four children. As a single parent, she uses her income for the general upkeep of her children.
Ama sells mutton at Waakrom near Cape Coast. She has been in this business for two years now. She will use her loan to purchase more mutton to sell. With her new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more mutton to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has six children.  
Ekua produces Fanti kenkey for sale (she is holding some of the kenkey she has produced). She has been in this business for six years. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding, clothing and paying their children’s school fees. Ekua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize, leaves and firewood to produce her kenkey for sale. With her new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, leaves and firewood to produce her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio es un hombre de 36 años de edad, estado civil conviviente , Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío La Matanza del distrito de Morropòn  y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 500 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Sergio  es la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, caprinos porcinos y aves de corral), lo cual lo comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace  4 años aproximadamente; es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Así mismo brinda servio de mototaxi en sus horas libres.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1008 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la compra de un motor para su vehiculo,  lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Sergio is 36 years old; and is in a common law marriage. He lives in his own house with his partner and their children. Their house is located in La Matanza, a hamlet of the Morropòn district, and it is equipped with electricity: about 500 families live in this community.
Sergio is a livestock farmer, breeding sheep, goats, pigs and poultry; he then sells the animals in the local market. He has been engaging in this activity for approximately 4 years, so he knows the trade to perfection. On top of this, he also offers moto- taxi* services in his free time.
He is asking for a loan of 1008 PEN, and he will use it to buy an engine for his vehicle: this will help him improve his standard of living.

*A “moto taxi” is a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his moto taxi..

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge  es un hombre que tiene 33  años de edad, de estado civil  casado, además  cuenta con 01 hijo que es menor de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Jorge vive en  el distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 60 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Jorge  es la crianza y venta de Ovinos, porcinos, caprinos , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Jorge  cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo él trabaja en su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.0 has de limón y mango  lo cual esta en producción y cosecha semanalmente lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales; su cónyuge también le apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Jorge se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 800 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde y compra de fertilizantes, bioestimulantes y pagos de jornales para su cultivo de limón; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge, 33, is married and has a minor son in his care.  He lives with his wife and son in his own house.  It’s noted that the quality of life in his community is at subsistence level.  Most of the residents work independently in commerce and animal husbandry and some of them also farm.  Jorge lives in Tambogrande District’s CP-10 settlement in Piura Department.  He only has electricity.  It’s also noted that approximately 60 families live in this settlement under these conditions.

Jorge’s commercial activity is raising sheep, pigs and goats to sell.  He raises them in corrals outside his house.  It’s worth stressing that Jorge has five years’ experience which has led to a well-established clientele for his business.  He also works in his field where he has 1 hectare planted with lemons and mangoes in production which he harvests weekly producing additional income for him.  His wife helps him very much with the activities he carries out; the two of them have a good family relationship.

Jorge has decided to expand his inventory with reference to the animal raising and selling because this is a very profitable activity in the zone and because of this is asking for a new, 800 new soles, loan to buy fertilizer, bio-stimulants and to pay day laborers for his lemon crops which in time will allow him to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals, to purchase fertilizers and biostimulants, and to hire day laborers for his lemon crop

loans.name: Rosa Lila

texts.es:
Rosa  es una mujer que tiene 40  años de edad, de estado civil  casado, además  cuenta con 02 hijos en edad escolar que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Rosa vive en  el caserío Punto Cuatro del distrito de Mochumi del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 200 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Rosa  es la crianza y venta de Ovinos, porcinos, caprinos y aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Rosa cuenta con 8 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad de Chiclayo; Así mismo su cónyuge trabaja en su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.5 has de cultivo de arroz lo cual presenta buen estado fenologico y le apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Rosa se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 2500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados y compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas y pago de jornales para su cultivo; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia
texts.en:
Rosa, 40, is married and has two school age children who are minors and in her care.  She lives with her husband and children in her own house.    It’s noted that the community’s quality of life is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents work independently in commerce and animal husbandry and some of them also farm.

Rosa lives in the settlement of Punto Cuatro in Mochumi District in Lambayeque Department; she only has electricity.  It’s also mentioned that approximately 200 families live in this settlement under these conditions.

Rosa’s commercial activity is raising sheep, pigs, goats and barnyard fowl to sell.  She raises them in corrals outside her house.  

It’s worth mentioning that Rosa has 8 years’ experience in this line of work which has allowed her to retain her well-established clientele.  She sells her animals to wholesalers in the city of Chiclayo.  Her spouse works in his field where he has 1.5 hectares planted with rice which is developing properly.  He supports her in all the activities she carries out there being a good family relationship between them.

Rosa has decided to increase her inventory with respect to the animal husbandry because it’s a very profitable activity in the zone which is why she’s asking for anew, 2500 new sol, loan to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay day laborers for her crops which in time will allow her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, farm supplies and to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Elidia

texts.es:
Elidía  es una mujer que tiene 68  años de edad, de estado civil  casada, sin ningún hijo a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge  en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Elidía vive en  el caserío Corral de Palos del distrito de Cayaltì del  departamento de  Lambayeque ,así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 50 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Elidía es la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche  y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Elidía cuenta con 12 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende su leche en el mercado de Cayalti; Así mismo su cónyuge también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.0  has de cultivo de maíz  lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y también le apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Elidía se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de leche, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/.2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados y arreglo de corrales para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia
texts.en:
Elidía, 68, is married and lives with her spouse in their own home, without any dependent children. She tells us that in her community, life is based on subsistence. Most residents are self-employed, engaging in trade and small animal husbandry. Some are also involved in agriculture. Elidía lives in the small village of Palos, Corral Cayalti, in the administrative district of Lambayeque. She only has basic electricity services, and says that in the village approximately 50 families live in these conditions.
