Raising nine children is no easy task.  Most of them attend higher level schools in the city of Lima so every month she sends a certain amount of money for them.  Thanks to her various activities she’s able to get sufficient capital to also invest in her crops and in her business.

Carmen has a store selling groceries and basic staple items to local residents.  She also grows potatoes, peas, corn and vegetables on her own land located half an hour from her house.

She’s been in this activity nearly 20 years and feels that she’s successful selling to wholesale merchants in the market.  She also raises livestock like calves, cows and bulls that she sells to obtain extra money.  She gets the most use from her cattle because she uses them as tools to plow the land.

Her objectives are centered on her children’s education and she will work hard to continue helping them with whatever she can.

She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” communal bank and this would be her loan #7 with MFP.  She’s very grateful for the support provided to date and this is why she commits to be punctual with her installment payments.

Carmen will use the money she’s requesting to buy three calves whose price varies between 400 and 500 soles that she plans to fatten up for subsequent sale.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Lealoaina

texts.en: Lealoaina is 22 years old and single. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for one year. Lealoaina has requested a loan to buy tools and fertilizer. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lealoaina will expand the business.

loans.use: to buy garden tools

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Né le 02 Août 1984, ce jeune menuisier est très ambitieux, ayant à son actif plus d’une dizaine années d’expérience. 
Il a dans son atelier sis dans son quartier,  quatre apprentis qui l’aident dans ses tâches. Sa clientèle est au-delà de sa région car bénéficiant régulièrement de commandes en provenance des autres régions. Il  compte renouveler certains de ses outils de travail et à l’occasion acheter du bois en quantité pour faire face à ses commandes.
 Avec le partenariat qu’il mène avec notre institution il compte dans le futur rendre son activité plus professionnelle avec plus de visibilité. De même être en mesure d’aider sa mère dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
This is a very ambitious young carpenter, born August 2, 1984, who has more than ten years of experience in his field.  His workshop is located in his neighborhood and four apprentices help him with his tasks. 

His customer base extends to other regions as he regularly receives orders from other geographic areas.  He is planning to upgrade some of his tools and, additionally, to buy enough wood to meet his orders.

Through partnership with our institution, his future plan is to make his business more professional and to have better visibility.  He would also like to be able to help his mother with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy wood to make and sell furniture.

loans.name: Monique

texts.en: Monique is 35 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy materials to improve her business. In the future, Monique hopes to save her profits to help her business and her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for making pancakes

loans.name: Alatauai

texts.en: Alatauai is a 19-year-old woman who is single. She plans to start a small lawn mowing business.  Alatauai needs a loan to purchase new lawn mowing equipment. She will use her profits to expand her business and help her kids' education. Alatauai joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for lawn mowing

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres se unieron y de esa unión surge el comité llamado mujeres valientes. Ellas son personas con muchas ganas de ayudar a sus familias, tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor y por sobre todo muchas ganas de trabajar y ayudarse a cumplir sus metas.
Claudelina es una de estas mujeres emprendedoras, comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, gracias a lo cual ha podido ayudar a su familia, y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día. Es una persona muy entusiasta y con deseos de superación.
Su meta es seguir ayudando y trabajando y es con ganas de seguir esta meta que solicita el crédito, ya que desea comprar prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca la temporada de frio y quiere tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fifteen women came together to form this union and the committee is called Courageous Women. They are people eager to support their families. They have a great entrepreneurial spirit and above all they are eager to work to help themselves accomplish their goals.

Claudelina is one of these women entrepreneurs. She comments that she works selling all types of clothing, thanks to which she has been able to help her family and support their daily needs. She is a enthusiastic person with the desire to triumph.

Her goal is to continue helping and working and she is eager to continue this goal by asking for a loan, as she wants to buy winter cloths, as the cold season is approaching and she wants to have a good variety to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Nurjamal

texts.ru:
Нуржамал 40 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Нуржамал на протяжении 8 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 12,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Нуржамал в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, доход от продажи молока составляет 4,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуржамал обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец и бычка.  Доходы от кредита Нуржамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Nurjamal is forty years old, married and she has four children. With a starting capital of 12,000 soms, Nurjamal began an animal breeding business eight years ago. Thanks to her hard work, she now owns one milking cow, one horse, and a monthly income of 4,000 soms generated from the sale of milk. With the hope of expanding her business further, Nurjamal approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for 100,000 soms (KGS) in order to purchase a bull and some sheep. 
She plans to invest profits from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Vitoria

texts.en: Vitoria is a 51-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells scones/doughnuts in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Vitoria needs a loan to buy more supplies and equipment for baking. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. Vitoria has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for baking

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 28 años, está casada con Erminio, con quien tiene 2 hijos; Braham y Verenise. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo- Tarma.  

Su principal actividad es la agricultura, ya lleva cerca de 10 años en la siembra de arvejas, habas, papa, maíz y hortalizas. “Mis terrenos están lejos, me demoro como media hora para llegar”, menciona. A pesar de eso, Luzmila, con la constancia que la caracteriza, todas las mañanas sube muy contenta a cuidar de sus cultivos, con la ayuda de su esposo y de peones que le ayudan en tiempos de cosecha. Cuando esto sucede, traslada sus productos hacia el mercado mayorista para negociarlos.
Ahora se está preparando para la siembra de arvejas, está segura que logrará buenos resultados, ya que estos meses son de campañas grandes y sus ventas se dan al por mayor, con compradores que llegan de la ciudad de Lima.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP. Se siente identificada con su grupo, a tal punto que es la tesorera, por esa razón se compromete en ser puntual en los pagos de sus cuotas. Ella siempre recurre a su banco comunal para solventar sus principales necesidades.
Luzmila invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 4 bolsas de semillas de arvejas, lo que suma 2200 soles. Lo restante lo empleará para comprar fertilizantes.
texts.en:
28-year old Luzmila is married to Erminio and they have two children, Braham and Verenise. They live in their own house located in the village of Bellavista Huaracayo, Tarma.

Luzmila’s principal source of income is agriculture. She’s been growing peas, beans, potatoes, maize and vegetables for about ten years. “My fields are far away; it takes me half an hour to get there,” she says. However, with the determination that characterizes her, Luzmila leaves the house every morning quite contentedly to tend her land. Her husband and some labourers help her at harvest time. When this takes place, she transports the produce to the wholesale market to sell.

Now she is preparing to sow peas. She is sure that the harvest will be profitable as it is a good time of year to sell the crops to buyers from Lima. 

Luzmila belongs to the Señor de Muruhuay Community Bank, and this is her fifth loan with MFP. She is a significant part of the group as she is treasurer, and for this reason she promises to be punctual with the repayments. She always turns to the bank for funds for important needs.  She plans to use the money to buy four bags of pea seeds which comes to 2200 soles. The rest of the money will be used to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Puaula

texts.en: Puaula is a 27 year-old woman who is married with five children. She plans to start a small business car washing.  Puaula needs a loan to buy more materials for business improvements. She will use her profits to help the business and attend to family matters. Puaula joined Kiva partner SPBD in 2009 in order to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her car wash business.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is from Sto. Niño,Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 60 years old. Felipa is widowed and has one child. To make a living, Felipa plants, harvests, and sells rice. She has been in her business for seven years and earns PHP 4,000 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Felipa joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Heidy Claribel

texts.es:
La señora esta separa de su esposo, tiene 24 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 2  de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la venta de comida y refacciones, inicio este negocio por iniciativa propia, lleva 2 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de verduras, frutas, leche, carnes, condimentos alimenticios, etc. Espera que su negocio en el futuro se grande.
texts.en:
This lady is separated from her husband, and is 24 years old. She did not have the opportunity to attend school. She has three children, two of which are students. She works selling food and spare parts. She began this business on her own initiative and has two years experience.

She is asking for a loan to be used to buy vegetables, fruit, milk, meat, food condiments, etc. She is hoping that her business will grow larger.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: Víctor es un joven soltero de 18 años. Vive en Portoviejo con sus padres. Víctor nos cuenta que desde los 14 años le ha gustado trabajar, empezó ayudando en el negocio de su tía ya que tenía muchos gastos y no tenia como solventarlos. Ahora que ya es mayor de edad emprendió la venta de granos al por menor de manera independiente, lo realiza solo recorriendo varios sectores de lunes a sábado sin horario establecido. La dificultas que se le presenta en la actualidad es que sus clientes se queden sin trabajo y no le puedan cancelar la mercadería. Con el préstamo comprara mas arroz para la venta con esto incrementar su negocio. Su sueño aunque ambicioso es agrandar su negocio de tal manera que pueda generar fuente de trabajo en su ciudad. Víctor eres un joven emprendedor esperamos que tus sueños se cumplan, suerte.
texts.en:
Victor is a single young man who is 18 years of age. He lives in Portoviejo with his parents. Victor says that he has enjoyed working ever since he was 14. He began helping out at his aunt's business because he had many expenses but no way to pay for them. Now that he is an adult, he started an independent business selling grains at retail. He travels by himself to different neighborhoods Monday through Saturday without a set schedule. His current difficulties include dealing with his customers who are unemployed and not able to pay for their merchandise.

With this loan, Victor will buy more rice to sell so that he can increase his business. His dream, although ambitious, is to expand his business to the point that he can create jobs in his city. Victor is a young entrepreneur who hopes to fulfill his dreams. He deserves the best of luck.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Torype Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
“Torype Oñondivepa” están  en el Décimo Sexto, y todo esto gracias al trabajo que todas ellas hacen juntas. Son mujeres con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ayudarse y trabajar todas juntas. El grupo tiene 18 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan siempre en un ambiente de cooperación y se ayudan las unas a las otras.
Maximina se define a su misma como una buena microempresaria, ella se dedica al comercio desde hace un tiempo, y es gracias a su pequeña despensa que puede ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa. Su meta es poder agrandar su local y alguna vez tener un gran negocio.
Ella pide el crédito a la fundación y a Kiva para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, fideos, arroz, yerba y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá darle a sus clientes una buena variedad.
texts.en:
“Torype Oñondivepa” is in the 16th loan cycle which is thanks to all the work that they do together. They are women who are eager to get ahead, helping themselves and working together. The group has 18 members, all of them always work together in an atmosphere of cooperation and they help one another.

Maximina describes herself as a good entrepreneur. She has been working in trade for some time, and it is thanks to her little store that she can help her family and give them everything they need in order to have a decent and proper life. Her goal is to be able to expand her facility and one day to have a bigger business. 

She is asking for a loan from the foundation and Kiva in order to buy drinks, milk, noodles, rice, yerba (mate) and other supplies with which she will be able to offer her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy drinks, milk, noodles, rice, yerba (mate) and other supplies

loans.name: Chonimacorral Group

texts.es:
La señora Paulina Susana. esta casada, tiene 29 años de edad, cursó los 5 años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijos, se dedica a la crianza de animales, inicio este negocio grado gallina y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la confección de prendas.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos y poder aumentar su negocio, ya que espera en el futuro contar con una granja. Las demás integrantes de grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales, venta de productos de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Paulina Susana is 29 years old, married with one child, and completed five years of primary school.  She makes a living raising animals.  She started off raising chickens and now has 7 years of experience.  She has the support of her husband, who makes garments.

She organizes a group to request a loan, which she will use to purchase hogs and improve her business.  In the future she hopes to have a farm.  The other members of the group make their livings in animal husbandry and the sale of everyday goods.

loans.use: to purchase hogs

loans.name: Taitasi

texts.en:
Taitasi is a 45-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Taitasi needs a loan to purchase more resources for making pancakes. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and help pay for her kids' education. 

Taitasi has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies for making pancakes.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is married with three children to care for. She is 40 years old and lives in Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

To earn a living, Virgie sells personal products such as fashion dresses, comforters and more. She has been operating this business for four years and earns 7000 PHP each month. 

She has requested a loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC to obtain more personal products to sell. Virgie has been a member of the cooperative for two years. 

In the future, Virgie hopes to be more progressive in this venture and would like to expand her facility and product offerings to attract more customers. She plans to procure trendy items to meet the market's current demands.

loans.use: to obtain more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Gustav

texts.en:
Gustav is 28 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling snacks, curry, rice, soft drinks and more in her community; she has been doing this for two years. 

Gustav joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. She has requested a loan to purchase more goods for her canteen and food stall. Gustav will use her earnings for home improvement expenses and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her food stall.

loans.name: Sara Amparo

texts.es:
La señora sara amparo vive en la ciudad de Managua , trabaja como comerciante en un mercado de Managua la actividad de su negocio es venta de verdura ,
Con el préstamo que obtuvo la señora va a comprar ayote, tamarindo, quequisque  para incrementar su inventario y hacer mantener su clientela.
Doña Sara  manifiesta que con los prestamos que ceprodel le da, ha aumentado su capital de trabajo , y por ende sus ganancia
texts.en:
Sra. Sara Amparo lives in the city of Managua. She works as a merchant at a market in Managua. Her business involves selling vegetables.

With this loan, Sra. Sara will buy squash, tamarind, and taro in order to increase her inventory and maintain her customer base. Doña Sara says that the loans given to her by CEPRODEL have increased her operating capital, as well as her earnings.

loans.use: to buy taro, tamarind, and squash.

loans.name: Jose Inocente

texts.es:
El señor Jose Inocente esta casado, tiene 24 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos que aun no estudian, se dedica a la sastrería y al comercio de calzados de plásticos, inicio este negocio de venta de calzado por iniciativa propia y lleva 6 meses de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo e su esposa. 

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para compra de una maquina para costura y poder compra mercadería de calzados de plástico y mejorar su ganancias, espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose is 24 years old, married, and has a sixth grade education. He has two children who are not in school. Jose works as a tailor and also sells plastic shoes. He started his business of selling shoes through his own initiative and now has six months of experience. Jose has the support of his wife.

He is requesting a loan to use for purchasing a sewing machine and an inventory of plastic shoes so that he can improve his earnings. In the future, Jose hopes to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es: Martha es una joven madre de familia que vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, área suburbana de la ciudad donde tiene su casa propia. A sus 27 años tiene varias actividades que le generan ingresos para su hogar. Martha nos cuenta que hace un año empezó la venta de productos por catálogos y zapatos ya que también labora como estilista en un gabinete de belleza. El trabajo lo realiza sola de lunes a domingo preferentemente en la mañana ya que en las tardes se encuentra en el gabinete. Su mayor preocupación es que al movilizarse le roben la mercadería o el dinero que haya recaudado por el cobro a sus cliente. En soltera pero tiene dos niños que asisten a la escuela particular, no le gusta la publica aunque no tendría costo porque le queda lejos de su domicilio. Con el crédito comprara productos como maquillaje, cremas, perfumes y zapatos. Su meta a futuro es terminar la construcción de su casa y abrir una peluquería unisex con lo cual pasaría más tiempo con sus hijos.
texts.en: Martha, 27, is a young mother who lives in her own house in a suburban area of Guayaquil.  She has various businesses that generate income for her household.  Martha tells us that a year ago she began to sell products from catalogs and shoes and she also works as a hair stylist in a beauty shop.  She sells only Mondays through Sundays, preferably in the mornings, since she works in the beauty shop in the afternoon.  Her biggest worry is that when she moves around to sell, she will be robbed of her merchandise or the money that she has collected from her customers.  She is a single mother with two children who go to a private school.  She doesn’t like the public school although it’s free because it’s very far from her house.  She will use the loan to buy makeup, creams, perfumes and shoes.  Her goal in the future is to finish building her house and to open a unisex beauty salon so she can spend more time with her children.

loans.use: to buy makeup, creams, perfumes and shoes

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old, married and has one child. Luzviminda used her last loan to purchase additional products to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to buy more personal products such as shoes, sandals and more. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products such as shoes, sandals and more

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a 45-year-old married woman with 3 children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Emmy has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, rakes, shovels, weed spray, chemicals, etc. 

This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. With her profits, Emmy hopes to expand her plantation with a vegetable garden and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for growing taro and bananas

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en: Sonya is a 33-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She runs a business selling groceries like chicken, sugar, rice, noodles, and cigarettes in her community. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Sonya has requested a loan to buy more goods. She plans to use her profits to expand the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Borrower Battulga is a 44-year-old widow who lives with her two children in an outer ger district, which lacks the basic infrastructure of the Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her children are attending university and high school, while she supports her family by operating a clothing stall business at a local indoor market. Battulga has operated this business since 2008. 

She usually sells womanswear, especially high heels, a variety of blouses, skinny trousers for young girls etc. which she imports from Beijing once every 2 months. 

The end of spring/beginning of summer is graduation season in Mongolia, so Battulga wants to increase her working capital and attract more customers during this period. She is requesting a 2.500.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase a variety of clothes to sell during the graduation season.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell during the graduation season

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es:
María de 61 años de edad, casada, originaria de Estelí, madre de 7 hijos todos mayores de edad viven independiente. Ella es comerciante desde hace  30 años en el negocio de pulpería, anteriormente  obtuvo un crédito por nuestra institución que fue de mucha ayuda ya que lo utilizo para invertir en su negocio en la compra de granos básicos tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, etc.  Actualmente esta solicitando el préstamo al igual para invertir en el negocio esta vez en la compra de pollo, huevo, azúcar, frijoles, etc. 
Sus metas son mantener su negocio estable con todo lo que demanda la clientela surtirlo con los productos que son de mayor necesidad en una pulpería al igual espera  seguir trabajando con créditos y el apoyo de nuestra institución con el objetivo de  invertir más en la pulpería para generar más ingresos y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old, married, comes from Estelí, and is the mother of seven children, who are all of age and live independently.  She has been a businesswoman for the past 30 years, working in a small restaurant.  Previously she obtained a loan through our lending institution, which was a great help to her, since she was able to invest the money in her business by buying basic items like rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, etc.  Currently, she is asking for a similar loan to invest in her business, this time to buy chicken, eggs, sugar, beans, etc.

Her goals are to maintain a stable business by meeting her customers' needs with the products that are most needed in a small restaurant, so she hopes to continue working through loans and the help of our institution with the goal of investing more in her restaurant to generate greater profits and get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, eggs, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Norelyn

texts.en: Norelyn is a 23-year-old single mom of an only child. She is living in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, where her wide garden production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 21 years of age until the present time. She doesn't mind the scratches and itches brought by this kind of plant, for as long as she can earn income, Norelyn goes for it. She normally receives 8,000 PHP a month. Earlier this year, Norelyn joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next planting. When the crop gets realized, the revenue from it will be allotted to expanding the business area to earn more income and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next planting

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is from Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 66 years old, married, with 4 children. Laura owns and operates a sari-sari store where she sells products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Laura has been in her business for 15 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Laura joined Kiva partner, GDMPC. Laura is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en:
Kalameli is 28 years old and single with no children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, etc. that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for the last year. Kalameli needs a loan to expand the business by purchasing additional farm supplies.

She became a member of SPBD in 2012. Kalameli will use the profits from her sales to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and more taro crops, etc.

loans.name: Siniva

texts.en: Siniva is a 61-year-old married woman with 1 child. She makes and sells round donuts, long donuts and meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has 5 years of experience with this business. Siniva needs a loan to buy more ingredients for her business. She plans to use her profits to build up her own food stall. Siniva has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and yeast for baking.

loans.name: María Félix

texts.es:
La señora María Félix   vive en la ciudad de Managua trabaja como comerciante en un mercado de la capital 
Es una persona responsable con grandes deseo de superación tanto en su trabajo como en su vida personal
La señora  María solicito el crédito en  nuestra institución para seguir creciendo en su negocio, con el dinero que presto va hacer la compra de maya de chiltona, para incrementar su negocio y así
 obtener mayor ganancia en  negocio Las mejoras que la señora va a realizar es la tapia en la parte trasera de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Félix lives in the city of Managua, where she works as a salesperson in the marketplace of the capital.  She is a responsible person with great dreams of success in her work as well as in her personal life.

María asked for this loan at our institution to continue growing her business.  With the money she is loaned she plans to buy sweet peppers to grow her business and make better profits at her work.  The improvements that this lady will make are to fence in the back part of her property.

loans.use: to buy sweet peppers.

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.es: Don Cayetano de 75 años, es el propietario de una carpintería ubicada en la ciudad de Cartagena donde vive con su esposa y tiene 7 hijos en las edades de 25 a 51 años. Desde sus 14 años aprendió su oficio, con un carpintero a quien ayudara en ese momento. De allí tomó toda su experiencia y siempre trabajaba soñando con su propio taller, hasta que en el año 1989 lo logró. Desde ese momento se dedicó a fabricar y vender muebles y también es contratado por empresas simultáneamente, porque conocen la calidad con la que trabaja.   Su meta es ampliar sus servicios de carpintería a productos de  metalmecánica, teniendo un taller más grande. En la actualidad está planeando su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará materiales e insumos para elaborar muebles y también hará pequeñas adecuaciones locativas. Su credikiva tendrá éxito porque está fundamentado en pedidos que han hecho sus clientes y además por su experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, que le ha generado una acreditada clientela.
texts.en: Cayetano is 75 years old. He is the owner of a carpentry shop located in the city of Cartagena, where he lives with his wife and seven children who are between the ages of 25 and 51. He began learning his trade when he was 14 years old, from a carpenter who he helped at that time. From there, he took all of his experience, dreamed of having his own workshop, and kept working until he achieved that in 1989. From that moment on he dedicated himself to making and selling furniture. He is simultaneously employed by companies because they know the quality of his work. Cayetano's goal is to expand his carpentry service to include metal working, and to have a larger workshop. He is currently planning on his first "credikiva," which will be the first financing that he has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy materials and supplies for furniture-making and he will also make some small adjustments to his workspace. This loan will be successful because it is based on orders that his customers have already made, and furthermore because Cayetano has generated a good client base thanks to his experience managing the business.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for making furniture

loans.name: Kerly Maria

texts.es: Kerly tiene 32 años, es madre soltera y vive en Duran. Es panificadora, empezó su negocio ya que sus hijos fueron creciendo con esto también lo hacían sus gastos, por esto se vio en la necesidad de iniciar su propio negocio. Kerly nos cuenta que su decisión fue acertada ya que le va bien, dedica gran parte del día a la elaboración de galletas y chavelitas contando con la ayuda de su hija mayor quien contribuye al salir de sus clases. El mayor riesgo que le presenta el negocio es al momento de la entrega  ya que lo realiza en sectores apartados de la ciudad lo cual aumento el riesgo de la delincuencia. Como es madre soltera se siente satisfecha de salir adelante con su familia sin mayores dificultades. Tiene 3 hijos los cuales tiene 18, 5 y 2 años de edad quienes estudian en la escuela y colegio fiscal. El préstamo lo va a utilizar en la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar para la elaboración de sus dulces. Le gustaría en próximos años dar a conocer sus productos con lo que tendría más clientes y mejorar su economía en beneficio de sus hijos.
texts.en: Kerly is 32 years old. She is a single mother and lives in Duran. She is a bread baker and started her business because her chidlren were growing and so were her expenses. Kerly tells us that her decision was confirmed because it is going well for her. She spends a big part of her day making cookies and chavelitas  Her oldest daughter helps when she gets out of school. The biggest risk in the business is that when she makes her deliveries she does them in places away from the city which elevates the risk of crime. Since she is a single mother, she feels satisfied getting ahead with her family without big difficulties. She has 3 children, aged 18, 5 and 2. They go to primary school and high school. She will use the loan to buy flour, lard, and sugar to make her sweets. fiscal. In the next few years she would like to have more customers and improve her finances for her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard and sugar.

loans.name: Adelaida Del Carme

texts.es:
La señora Adelaida  del Carmen    tiene su negocio en  un mercado de  Managua  venta de queso, pero además de comercializarlo también lo procesa  tiene las maquinas para la elaboración de ellos  es por eso que su crédito lo utiliza para  la compra de leche de vaca para realizar el queso ,crema ,queso quesillo, 
La señora vende al por mayor a los pequeños comerciante del mercado, doña Adelaida  manifiesta que con los prestamos de ceprodel ha podido mantener sus productos  y así ofertar   productos  a su clientela
texts.en:
Adelaida del Carme has a business in a market in Managua where she sells cheese. She also has machinery that allows her to make cheeses, and she is requesting this loan in order to purchase milk to use in the cheese making process. She makes cheese, cream, cheesecake, etc, and sells her products in bulk to the smaller vendors in the market. 

Adelaida is grateful for the loans she has received through Ceprodel, as they have helped her to keep up her business and production, and they allow her to offer high quality products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase milk in bulk.

loans.name: Vitelia

texts.es: Vitelia con su anterior credikiva compró materiales y elaboró las mas hermosas hamacas y mochilas y las vendió muy pronto. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual planea comprar hilo fino por pacas, forros y acondicionará un poco el local, porque tiene muchos encargos y va a responder a ellos para ganar un poco mas de dinero y podrá ofrecer unas instalaciones atractivas a sus clientes actuales y potenciales. Ella dice a los finaciadores de Kiva que está muy agradecida con los créditos por facilitarles trabajar mas comodamente y poder producir ingresos para su hogar".
texts.en: With her previous loan Vitelia  bought materials and made the most beautiful hammocks and backpacks and sold them very quickly.  She is now applying for a new loan with which she plans to buy parcels of fine yarn for upholstery and to improve her shop a little bit.  This is because she has many orders and she wants to fill them to gain a bit more money and to be able to make her business premises more attractive to present and future clients. She says to the Kiva lenders that she is very grateful for the loans for allowing her to work more comfortably and to be able to earn more income for her household.

loans.use: to buy parcels of fine yarn for upholstery and to improve her shop a bit.

loans.name: Leiloa

texts.en: Leiloa is 65 years old and married with five children. She has a small garden where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Leiloa needs a loan to improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Leiloa will use the profits from her sales for housing improvements.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and more taro crops

loans.name: Tepa

texts.en: Tepa is a 49-year-old married woman with one child.  She would like to start growing taro and bananas to earn a living. Tepa has requested a loan to buy taro crops and chemicals for the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Tepa will spend her profits to pay her child's fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for growing taro

loans.name: Venus

texts.en: Venus is from Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 39 years old. Venus is married and has six children. To make a living, Venus operates a specialized retail store. Venus been in her business for five years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Venus joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner. Venus is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase candies, shampoo, soap, sugar, salt, biscuits, coffee and more. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase candies, shampoo, soap, sugar, salt, biscuits, coffee and more.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en: Efren, 29, is from Tabid, Ozamiz City. He is married and has three children. Efren owns and operates a coconut production business venture. Efren has been engaged in his business for three years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Efren joined GDMPC. Efren is requesting a loan of 5,300 PHP which will be used to purchase seed, seedlings, and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seed, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 52 years old and married with eight children, three in school. Evangeline works very hard to provide for her children, running a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Henry Giovany

texts.es:
Henry es un hombre muy trabajador y sobre todo entusiasta, su vivienda se encuentra en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú; se caracteriza por su clima cálido y también porque se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos del barrio sobre todo para distraerse de las preocupaciones del dia, asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra”. El estudio estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería de Minas pero debido a algunos problemas económicos solo estudio hasta el tercer año de esa carrera.

Con esfuerzo y entusiasmo Henry se dedica a su negocio de venta de equipos para minería, el trabaja alrededor de 4 horas al día y puede atender hasta 6 clientes diariamente, el cree que le va bien su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque siempre asesora a sus clientes y por ello siempre lo recomiendan.

Henry está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar más equipos para su negocio, lo que le permitirá tener más productos y poder cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes, así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos, con esta mejora podrá seguir trabajando y luchando día a día para hacer realidad sus mas grande sueño:” Terminar de estudiar su carrera y ser un buen profesional”.
texts.en:
Henry is a very hardworking and enthusiastic man. His house is in Parcona district, Ica, Perú, an area characterized by a warm climate and also agriculture and livestock. When Henry has spare time, he enjoys playing soccer with his neighbors in the neighborhood, above all to distract himself from the day’s worries. He also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Carapulcra”. He was studying the profession of mining engineering, however due to economic problems he only studied until the third year in that career.

Henry dedicates himself enthusiastically to his business selling mining equipment. He works about 4 hours a day and tends up to 6 clients daily. He believes that his business is doing well because he is very helpful to his customers and always advises them and consequently they always recommend him to others.

Henry is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they have provided him, he will be able to purchase more equipment for his business, which will enable him to have more products and fill more orders for his clients. Thus he will be able to increase his earnings. With this improvement he will be able to continue working and fighting day after day to fulfill his greatest dream: “To finish his studies for his career and become a good professional.”

loans.use: to purchase mining equipment.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en: Cipriana is married, 55 years of age, and lives in Gala, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental together with her two kids. Cipriana buys and sells bamboo trees to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and she earns 5,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 7,650 PHP to purchase equipment for bamboo cleaning. She joined GDMPC in 2007. In the future, Cipriana will use her income to support her kids in their studies until they finish college and in their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for bamboo cleaning.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 32 years old, married and lives in Canibungan Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Norma plants bananas on her own plot of land to earn a living. She has been in this business for eight years and earns 6,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 9,600 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Norma has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC for two years. In the future, Norma's plan is to save her profit in order to buy a new house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is from Labinay, Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old. Gloria is married and has three children. To make a living, Gloria manages a general store. Gloria has been in her business for 14 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Gloria joined GDMPC. Gloria is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en: Gantumur, 33, runs a grocery store near her home. She lives with her husband and 1-year-old daughter in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. She opened her store three years ago and she has a good experience in her business. She started her business with 500.000 MNT in groceries and now her sales volume has increased to 6.000.000 MNT. She said that it is the main income source of her family since her husband is still unemployed. Now Gantumur wants to increase her business working capital, such as groceries. She buys her groceries from some biggest supermarkets in the city. The loan she takes will be dedicated to increase the working capital of her grocery store.

loans.use: to increase the working capital of her grocery store.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 56 years old, married and has six children, one in school. Narcisa works very hard to provide for them, running a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Narcisa has been in this business for four years. In the future, Narcisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tugsjargal

texts.en: Mr. Tugsjargal, 48, has worked as a watchman for the last six consecutive years. He lives with his wife and his two children in their small and old house, which is in the ger district. His house is a Mongolian nomadic traditional yurt located in Kherlen, a Mongolian eastern city. His wife feeds chickens in her back yard. Tugsjargal is requesting a loan to repair and insulate the walls of his house. Most of the parts of his house have gotten old and are uncomfortable to live in. Insulating the wall will reduce the heat loss in the winter. He believes it will also cut his family’s smoky coal usage and emission of poisonous smoke into the air as well as save on heating costs. Air quality is at a dangerous level in the cities around Mongolia and it is one of the biggest problems faced by the Mongolian government at the moment. The loan will be used to buy building materials to make repairs and insulate the walls of his old, bad house.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 58 years old and widowed with two children, one in school. Nelia works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of  PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Nelia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Nelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Mrs. Bolormaa, 38, is a driver. She has been running a taxi business for the last few years. She lives with her family in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic traditional yurt, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. Since 2009, she has been working as a taxi driver in a private taxi company. She bought her car from her company two years ago and she has not been able to pay it off in full. Now she has to make her car’s remaining payment of 1.000.000 MNT with her loan.  The rest of the loan will be used to make some repairs to her car, such as changing the spare parts for better ones. The loan she is taking will be used to cover the cost of her car and the repairs.

loans.use: To make the final car payments and make repairs to the car.

loans.name: Fofoga

texts.en:
Fofoga is 41 years old and married with five children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro and taamu (giant taro) that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Fofoga needs a loan to buy farm supplies to improve her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Fofoga will use the profits from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for growing taro

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her bakery business.

Elena has been in this business for 24 years. Elena earns more income from selling dried fish and from pig fattening.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos vive con su cónyuge en San Jacinto. Allí se dedica a ofrecer servicios automotriz en su taller ubicado al lado se su vivienda. Este oficio lo realiza por tradición familiar, lo heredó de su padre fallecido y  de él depende económicamente. En la actualidad está aplicando a su tercer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual ha logrado ampliar su taller, tener su propia casa a la cual con sus ingresos ha hecho varios arreglos. Su meta mas adelante es tener maquinarias modernas poder ofrecer otros servicios, y generar empleos, para que otros también accedan a ingreso con los cuales poder vivir.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el que comprará  aceite para motores de carros y motocicletas; además comprará llaves y herramientas varias y arreglará el techo de su taller.  Su inversión tendrá éxito porque comprará insumos en mayor volumen y ganará descuentos, disminuyendo así el costo del  servicio, su trabajo será más efectivo con herramientas adecuadas y protegido de la lluvia,  que puede causar problemas en sus operaciones eléctricas, lo cual se tornaría peligroso. Además de todo esto a Juan Carlos lo acompaña su gusto por el trabajo, la calidad con la que lo desarrolla y su vocación de servicio que son la base del sostenimiento de su clientela.
texts.en: Juan Carlos lives with his partner in San Jacinto, where he dedicates himself to offering automotive services in a workshop located next to his home. This line of work is a family tradition -- he inherited it from his deceased father and he depends on it financially. He is currently applying for his third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has helped him expand his workshop, own his own house, and make various repairs. His future goal is to have modern machinery, to be able to offer additional services, and to generate jobs so that others can have access to an income to live on. He is currently requesting a "credikiva" to buy motor oil for cars and motorcycles; to buy keys and various tools; and to fix the roof of his workshop. His investment will be successful because Juan Carlos will get a discount by buying materials in a higher volume, thereby decreasing the cost of his services. His work will be more effective with adequate tools and protection from the rain, which can cause dangerous problems with his electrical operations. On top of that, Juan Carlos takes great pleasure in his work. The quality of his work and his dedication to service are the way he maintains his clientele.

loans.use: to buy motor oil for cars and motorcycles; to buy keys and various tools; and to fix the roof of his workshop

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
For 20 years in Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Lilia, a 61-year-old, now a widow and the mother of one child, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Matainofo

texts.en:
Matainofo is a 26-year-old married woman with 1 child. 

She would like to start growing crops on a plantation to earn a living. Matainofo has requested a loan to purchase farming supplies. She will also use part of her loan to expand her house. 

She has been a member of SPBD for 3 years. Matainofo will spend her profits to improve her business and expand her house.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Noly

texts.en:
Noly is 39 years old and married with 2 children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Noly runs a buying and selling charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Noly would like to save money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
As a parent of four children, Remia works hard to support her family.

She has a herbal product retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Remia has requested to borrow PHP 22.000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her herbal product retail business.

Remia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additonal stock to sell in her herbal retail business.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en: Sesilia is a 39 year old woman who is married with five children.  She runs a business selling a variety of goods in a small shop in her community.  She had two years of experience with this business.  Sesilia has requested a loan to expand her shop.  She plans to use her profits to buy more products. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Vaitupua

texts.en:
Vaiotupua is 43 years old and married with twelve children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows taro and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Vaiotupua needs a loan to by farming supplies to improve her business.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2011.. Vaiotupua will use the profits from her sales to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies to grow taro.

loans.name: Talaiga

texts.en:
Talaiga is thirty-four years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a business venture, making elei (Samoan printed cloth). She has three years of experience in this line of business. 

Talaiga needs a loan to buy more materials and supplies like paint. She hopes to use her profits to improve business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials and paints to make elei (Samoan printed cloth).

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is from Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is twenty-six years old. Leonora is married and has two children. To make a living, Leonora plants, harvests and sells rice. Leonora has been engaged in her business for five years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Leonora joined GDMPC. Leonora is requesting a loan of PHP 6,300 which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married and has three children. Evangeline is fifty-four years old, and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Evangeline owns and operates a gardening business to earn a living and she's been in this business for fifteen years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 3,200 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next planting season. In 2008, Evangeline joined GDMPC. In the future, Evangeline wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next planting season.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is forty-six years old, married, and has ten children. She's from Gala Ozamis City. Elma used her last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Her business has grown and become successful. 

Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She has a positive attitude and hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is married. Emelita is thirty-six years old and lives in the Philippines.

Emelita is a farmer and she raises ginger and corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years and every month she earns PHP 12,230 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 18,400 to purchase fertilizer.

Emelita has been a member of GDMPC since 2005. In the future, Emelita hopes to increase the size of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is fifty-five years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Lolita has a dried fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 which she will use to purchase additional dried fish. 

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Lolita hopes to build her own dried fish stall.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire « Sephora », est un entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 26 ans, mère de 3 jeunes enfants. Elle est  vendeuse de carburant (petite pétrolière). Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans cette activité. Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la route, à l’entrée du quartier TMK, alors point stratégique d’embarquement d’auto bus-taxi. Il y a 5 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  5  cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  4 bidons de pétroles (d’essences kérosène, Mazout, motor oil)  à marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et  construire une maison d’habitation.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées de pauvres femmes pour leur émancipation économique et financière.
texts.en:
The borrower is the leader of the SEPHORA business group.  She is a dynamic 26-year-old entrepreneur, mother of three young children.  She has a small fuel retail business and sells gasoline.  She and her husband work together in this business.  She sets her goods on the side of the road, near the entrance of the TMK neighborhood, which is a strategic point where taxis (cars and buses) start their routes.  She has been involved in this type of small income-generating activity for more than 5 years now.

She has just completed five loan cycles with Hekima.  This new loan will be used to purchase 4 containers of liquid fuel (kerosene, Mazout, motor oil) for resale.

She would also like to build a house and see her children grow up comfortably.  She thanks Hekima for its actions dedicated to the economic and financial empowerment of low-income women.

loans.use: to buy 4 containers of liquid fuel (Kerosene, mazout, motor oil).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
Tserendolgor is a twenty-seven-year-old woman who lives with her husband, mother, and two children in suburban area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is employed. The oldest child goes to kindergarden. She started a construction-material retail business based on her experience of working as a shop assistant. She trades the products at a good price and now the business activity is stable. 

Tserendolgor is a diligent woman who says that "I would like to develop the business activity by purchasing supplies in large quantities. I am planning to trade them wholesale as the construction season is starting here". 

The total amount she is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT to buy construction supplies.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar is a forty-nine-year-old man who lives with his wife and a daughter in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. His daughter studies at secondary school. He has been running a taxi service business for four years. Previously, he used to work for an army unit and as a gardener. He has many regular customers and his business is stable. 

Ulambayar is a hardworking and gentle man who says that "I would like to expand the business activities by replacing the motorcycle with a van. By doing that, I will have more customers and profits". 

The total amount he is requesting is 1,100,000 MNT to buy a van.

loans.use: To buy a van.

loans.name: Uugantsetseg

texts.en:
Uugantsetseg is a twenty-five-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Govisumber province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband is employed as a welder. Her children stay at home. She has been running a food cart business for many years. Her mother has sold food at the train station since she was little. Uugantsetseg usually prepares the food in packages and trades them at the train stations. Her business has many regular customers. 

She is planning to operate a cafe business with help from her mother and she needs some financing for the business which will help to keep the food safe. Also, she needs a solar panel, table and chairs for her cafe. Uugantsetseg is an active and diligent woman who says that "In the future I would like to develop my business activities and save my money for my children". 

The total amount she is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to buy the necessary equipment to open her new ger cafe business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary equipment to open her new ger cafe business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase an outboard motor

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander  de 41 años es un hombre casado que tiene tres hijos en las edades de 8 a 13 años y vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, en el proyecto de vivienda sostenible gestionado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Allí se dedica a fabricar puertas, ventanas y rejas de hierro, desde hace 20 años, pues trabajó en la Empresa Colombiana de Petróleo y cuando no obtuvo contratos hace 2 años se dedicó a su propio negocio, para resolver los gastos de su hogar y con ello le ha ido muy bien. Su meta y gran desafío, es tener un buen local lejos de su vivienda, pues no es cómodo para el ambiente familiar tener allí su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará varillas de hierro, soldadura pintura y ornamentación para fabricar productos férreos. Con su credikiva, planea empezar su etapa de aumento de capital para más adelante generar más ingresos y empleos productos de su microempresa.
texts.en: Alexander, 41 years of age, is a married man with three children between the ages of 8 and 13 years old. He lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias in the sustainable housing project administered by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. There he has made a living manufacturing doors and iron windows and grilles for twenty years. He worked for the Colombian Oil Company (Empresa Colombiana de Petróleo) and when he didn't get contracts two years ago he devoted himself to his own business in order to settle his household expenses. With this things have gone well for him. His goal and great challenge is to have a strong business outside of his home as it's not comfortable for the family environment to have his business there. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing he has requested from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy iron rods, welding paint, and ornamentation to manufacture iron products with the loan. He also plans to begin the stage of increasing capital with the loan in order to generate more earnings and employment in the future, products of his small business.

loans.use: to buy iron rods, welding paint, and ornamentation to manufacture iron products.

loans.name: Resilda

texts.en:
Resilda works hard to support her family. Resilda is married and has a business buying and selling herbal products in the Philippines.

Resilda requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal products.

Resilda has been in this business for fifteen years now.

In the future, Resilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of herbal products.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dress-shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy clothes and other materials for her dress-shop business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for fifteen years. Lilibeth earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes and other materials for dress-making.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is thirty years old and married with two children.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a seaweed retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more seaweed to sell.

Mary Grace has borrowed and paid for twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the seaweed retail business for seven years and also earns an income from farming seaweed.

Mary Grace aspires to saving money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Lilita

texts.en:
Lilita is thirty-nine years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilita has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is forty-eight years old and has one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Pacita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed, pigs and vitamins for her pigs.

Pacita has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from dress-making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional feed, pigs and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Calixtro Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Calixtro Pedro esta casado, tiene 41 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 1 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía, al tejido de cortes típicos,inicio este trabajo por iniciativa propia y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales: hilos de diferentes clases y colores, espera en un futuro próximo tener un negocio prosperado y mejorado.
texts.en:
Calixtro Pedro is married, 41 years old, and studied for the six years of primary school. He has three children, one of whom is in school. He makes a living producing traditional crafts and weaving traditional patterns. He began this work due to his own initiative and has five years of experience.

He is requesting a loan that he will use to buy materials like different kinds and colors of thread. In the near future he hopes to have his own thriving and improved business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to weave patterns.

loans.name: Reyfrancis

texts.en:
Reyfrancis is forty-five years old and married with seven children.

Reyfrancis works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling seaweed in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more seaweed to sell.

Reyfrancis has borrowed and paid for sixteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling seaweed for seventeen years and also earns an income from fishing.

Reyfrancis aspires to saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is forty-four years old and married with two children.

Rosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Rosa has borrowed and paid for two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosa aspires to saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Roselen

texts.en:
Roselen is thirty-nine years old and married with two children. With her two children in school, Roselen works very hard to provide for them.

Roselen runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Roselen has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as spices, shampoo, canned goods and snack foods. 

In the future, Roselen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
Luzvisminda is 61 years old and married with 4 children.

Luzvisminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Luzvisminda has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from the direct selling of Avon products.

Luzvisminda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 62 years old and widowed with 8 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, toothpaste, eggs and spices. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Oswaldo Israel

texts.es:
Oswaldo es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive al lado de su esposa y de sus 2 pequeños hijos a los cuales quiere mucho y son su razón de vivir, su razón de despertarse cada día y luchar y luchar para darles los mejor para que tengan una vida de calidad y sobre todo con amor y felicidad. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de la Tinguiña, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte sobre todo jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio, asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Cau Cau”; el solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería de Sistemas.

Día a día Oswaldo sale a trabajar en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 42 clientes en el día, también tiene un negocio de videojuegos el cual se ubica en su vivienda; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque hay mucha necesidad de movilidad en su barrio.

Oswaldo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar un televisor y una consola de videojuego para su negocio, con lo cual podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio, así mejoraran sus ingresos y seguirá trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is very hardworking and enthusiastic man. He lives with his wife and their two small children whom he loves very much. They are his reason to live, his reason to wake up every morning and fight and fight to give them the best so that they have a quality life and above all else do this with love and happiness. His home is located in the district of Tinguiña which is characterized by a warm and welcoming climate and also by farming and livestock. In his free time he likes to play sports and above all play soccer with his neighbors and friends from his neighborhood. He also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes which is the delicious "Cau cau." He only studied through high school, but would have liked to study systems engineering.

Day after day Oswaldo goes out to work at his business as a auto rickshaw driver. He works around 10 hours a day and can have up to 42 customers in one day. He also has a video game business which is located in his home. He believes that things are going well with his business because he is responsible and above all because there's a great need for mobility in his neighborhood.

Oswaldo is very thankful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help, they will have enabled him to buy a television and a video game console for his business with which he will be able to offer a better service. Thus his earnings will improve and he will continue working to make his great dream- "to have a bigger business"- a reality.

loans.use: to buy a television and a video game console.

loans.name: Sheva May

texts.en:
Sheva May is 32 years old. She is married with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Sheva May has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Sheva May has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel is a 42-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His children study in secondary school. 

Altangerel started retailing sacks of coal and wood in 2001. He owns a counter at the market center. Altangerel's wife helps him with the business activities. He is planning to buy a truck for his business in order to make it much easier to handle the activities. 

Altangerel is an honest and gentle man who says, "I would like to expand the business activities by purchasing the coal and wood in large quantities. I have a further plan to buy a truck." The total amount he is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to buy wood and coal.

loans.use: to buy wood and coal.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La socia Benita nació en la ciudad de Anta de la provincia del Anta del departamento de Cusco y vive donde nació. Benita es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos. Sus actividades de Benita  son la agricultura, la ganadería y el comercio entonces su actividad principal que emplea más tiempo es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y chanchos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comida para los animales menores y para comprar semillas. 

La socia Benita pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Benita was born and lives in the city of Anta, province of Anta in the department of Cusco.  She is a widow with four children.  She earns a living working in agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.  She spends most of her time raising small animals such as guinea pigs and pigs.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and seeds.

She is a member of the communal bank "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta" which belongs to the Arariwa Association in the province of Cusco.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and seeds.

loans.name: Yasmin Jordany

texts.es:
Yasmin es una joven de 23 años la cual es muy trabajadora y sobre todo entusiasta y optimista, es madre de un pequeño de 6 años, por el cual ella se esfuerza mucho y sobre todo lo ha sacado adelante sola ya que el padre de su hijo la abandono y se convirtió en madre y padre para él. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido además de tener a “Las Líneas de Nazca”, las cuales son dibujos extensos en medio de un campo grande y árido las cuales son visitadas por infinidad de turistas en todo el año. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música sobre todo al lado de su pequeño ya que comienzan a cantar y aunque no lo hacen muy bien se divierten mucho, así también le gusta disfrutar su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”.

Con entusiasmo Yasmin trabaja en su negocio de venta Hamburguesas y también a la pesca artesanal, ella trabaja alrededor de 6 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque trabaja con gusto y con ganas de salir adelante.

Yasmin está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá dar un mantenimiento a su bote en especial pintarlo, instalar el motor y realizar la inscripción del mismo, así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y también mejorar su calidad de vida para seguir luchando y hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Yasmin, 23, is a hard-working, young woman who is especially enthusiastic and optimistic.  She is the mother of a six-year-old son and makes every effort to raise him on her own, since the boy's father left them and she had to become both mother and father.  Her house is located in the city of Nazca which is known for its warm climate and for the "Líneas de Nazca" (Nazca Lines), which are extensive drawings in the middle of a large, dry field which is visited by many tourists every year.  In her free time she enjoys listening to music with her little boy, since they begin to sing and have fun even though they don't sing very well.  She also enjoys eating her favorite dish, which is the delicious "Ceviche".

Yasmin works with enthusiasm at her hamburguer business and is also active in artisan fishing.  She works about six hours and attends to up to 15 customers a day.  She believes business is doing so well because she enjoys it and is determined to get ahead.

Yasmin is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, through their help, she has been able to provide maintenance for her boat (paint, motor and registration).  This will enable her to improve her income and quality of life to continue striving toward her goal of: "Building her own house".

loans.use: To pay for boat maintenance (paint, motor and registration).

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
