With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own a big poultry farm which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and chicks

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD. She repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She will use this loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for use during this planting season.

She hopes to be a leading farmer in her area and give her child a better education.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 38 years old, married, and blessed with six children aged 24, 20, 15-year-old twins, 13, and 10 years respectively. She is a farmer, a practice she started twelve years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase four bags of fertilizer, 10 kgs of maize seeds, and beans for the planting season.

The anticipated profit will aid her in educating her children. She hopes to continue with farming as well as educate her children. This is her fourth loan.

loans.use: to purchase four bags of fertilizer, 10 kgs of maize seeds, and beans for the planting season.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to buy another quarry site so as to expand his business.

He hopes to become among the top miners in his area and see his children through their education.

loans.use: to buy another  quarry site.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 41-year-old single woman with one child. She runs a greengrocery and has been in the business for twelve years now. She gets a monthly income of 80,000 shillings. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock, such as onions and potatoes. With the profits, she will buy a plot of land and build. In the future, she wants to have a good future with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as onions and potatoes

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en: Jovia is a 49-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She has personal goals of educating her children and building a permanent house for her residence.  She is a farmer and has been farming for the last ten years. Her hardships include price fluctuation, inflation, and unpredictable seasonal weather changes; however, she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets and hiring employees to expand her business.  Jovia needs the loan to complete building her house.

loans.use: To complete building her house

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 31 years old and married with two children.  He takes care of three relatives. He sells charcoal in sacs, and he has been in this business for three years. His business is open from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day each week. 

Jean Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more charcoal in sacs to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal in sacs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock for sale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, 26, is a single lady who supports her mother. She is a business woman who sells a variety of cereals. She has been in operation for three years earning a monthly income of 6,000 KES.  

Caroline is requesting her first loan, at 20,000 KES, from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to purchase bags of dry maize to sell.  

The profits will be used to repay the loan and venture into other business that will earn her some income. Caroline hopes to succeed in business and create a stable life for herself.

loans.use: to buy maize for sale.

loans.name: Give It Back Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Kenema city 29 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has two children, one in primary school and one in secondary school. Kadiatu sells clothes and has been doing this business for many years now. 

This is the first loan that Kadiatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and improve their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (1,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL)) to expand her business. She will buy ready-to-wear-clothes in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear-clothes in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes  de 64 años de edad madre de una hija en la edad de 37.  Ella se dedica a confeccionar ropa y a vender mercancías, negocios con los cuales ha logrado salir adelante con su hija. En su pequeño apartamento tiene su propio taller donde elabora cubre lechos, edredones, cortinas, manteles y forros para sillas plásticas, que se usan en eventos lúdicos, además de ropa femenina, masculina e infantil. Mercedes es una mujer polifacética, pues además de fabricación de productos de confección, también vende mercancías variadas, elabora cuadros decorativos, prepara comidas especiales, pasabocas, alquila sillas y mesas para eventos festivos, es decir ella siempre está ocupada en algo productivo. Oriunda de la Ciudad de Santa Marta, ciudad ubicada a orillas del mar caribe, es una mujer dinámica que vive con su nieto y su hija. En su negocio la temporada del mes de Mayo es la mejor y quiere aprovecharla, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará telas e insumos para fabricar edredones cubre lechos que tiene encargados por sus clientes quienes hacen que toda esta inversión tenga mucho éxito.
texts.en: Mercedes is 64 years old and mother to a daughter aged 37. She makes clothes and sells merchandise and that is how she supports herself and her daughter. She has her own sewing workshop in her small flat, where she makes quilts, duvets, curtains, tablecloths, covers for plastic chairs (used during parties), and clothes for men, women and children. Mercedes is a woman of many talents, for on top of making clothes, she also sells various products, prepares meals for special occasions and finger food for events, and leases chairs and tables for parties. So she is always busy with something productive. A native of the city of San Marta, located on the Caribbean coast, she is a dynamic woman who lives with her daughter and grandson. For her business, May is the best month, and she wants to take advantage of it. This is why she asks for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the funds to buy cloth and supplies in order to make quilts and duvets ordered by her customers, who are the reason she is confident her investment will pay off.

loans.use: to buy cloth and supplies to make quilts and duvets ordered by her customers.

loans.name: Keyserling Jonathan Angelo

texts.es:
Jonathan es un joven de 20 años el cual es muy trabajador y sobre todo tiene mucho entusiasmo por salir adelante, vive al lado de su joven esposa de de su pequeño de 1 añito de edad, por quien trabaja de sol a sol con tal de darle lo necesario para tener una vida con calidad y sobre todo con mucho amor y afecto. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, playas hermosas y por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo se caracteriza por la buena sazón que tienen sus pobladores para la preparación de platillos. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre  lo dedica para realizar sus trabajos estudiantiles ya que con mucho esfuerzo él está estudiando la carrera técnica de mantenimiento de mecánica; también aprovecha la oportunidad para comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”.

Con esfuerzo y sobre todo entusiasmo Jonathan trabaja en su negocio de venta de repuestos  y mantenimiento de fotocopiadoras, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 6 clientes en la semana;  el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque realiza un buen trabajo y sobre todo es responsable y cumplido con sus clientes.

Jonathan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas mercadería como repuestos para las fotocopiadoras, así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida para así seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una mejor calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 20 years old, a hard-worker, and despite everything he has a great desire to get ahead.  He lives alongside his young wife and their small one-year-old child for whom he works from dawn to dusk.  He works hard in order to provide everything necessary for his child to live a rich life, and above all he does it with love and affection.  His house is located in the city of Chincha, a city characterized by its warm climate, beautiful beaches, and as being the birthplace of the great glories of Peruvian sport.  It is also characterized by the resident's great taste in preparing dishes.  When Jonathan has free time he studies for a technical degree in mechanical maintenance.  He also takes the opportunity to enjoy his favorite dishes, one of which is the delicious "Arroz Chaufa."

With effort and unending enthusiasm, Jonathon works at his business of selling spare parts and providing copy machine maintenance.  He works about 8 hours per day and can attend to 6 clients in the week.  He believes that his business will go well because he is a good worker and above all he is responsible and dedicated to his customers.

Jonathon is very thankful for the Kiva lenders and sends his thanks for the help they have provided him.  He will be able to buy merchandise and parts for the copy machines and this will enable him to increase his income and improve his standard of living.  He will continue working and struggling to make his biggest dream come true: to have his own home and to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy parts for copy machines.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy tiene 27 años, es soltera y madre de un pequeño de 4 años llamado Jefferson. Ella vive en la casa de sus padres, la que se ubica en Huasahuasi – Tarma.

Ella tiene 9 años de experiencia en la agricultura, tiempo suficiente para poder dar fe de su éxito; ya que con las ganancias que obtienen sostiene sus principales gastos (ropa, alimentos y la educación para su hijo). Pero lo más importante para ella es progresar y salir adelante. Con la ayuda de su banco comunal pudo incrementar sus sembríos de papa, y ahora comercializa al por mayor en el mercado central de la ciudad. Es así que cada nueva cosecha obtiene mejores ganancias, fruto de las constantes charlas y capacitaciones que reciben y de su esfuerzo.
“Con la agricultura he podido ahorrar dinero, ahora tengo mis propias chacras porque antes trabajaba en los terrenos de mis padres”, comenta orgullosa. Por eso, para más adelante, con los ahorros que tiene, está pensando adquirir otros terrenos de cultivo y así aumentar su producción.

Éste sería su crédito número 2 con MFP. Por eso menciona que pagará las cuotas mensuales sin problemas. Además dice estar contenta de pertenecer al banco comunal “Unión Huanchán”, por el trabajo solidario y responsable de sus compañeros.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará dos bolsas de semillas de arveja (1200 soles). Los 800 restantes los utilizará para la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Lucy, 27, is single and the mother of a little four-year-old called Jefferson.  She lives in her parents’ house located in Huasahuasi-Tarma.

She has nine years’ experience in agriculture, plenty of time to give faith of her success because with profits obtained she covers her main costs (clothes, food and her child’s schooling).  But what’s most important for her is to make progress and to get ahead.  With help from her communal bank she was able to increase her potato crops and now she sells at wholesale in the city’s central market.  This is how she obtains better profits from each harvest, the fruits of the constant chats and training they receive and of her own effort.

She proudly states: “Through agriculture I’ve been able to save money. Now I have my own plots of land because I used to work my parents’ fields.”  Because of this, for later on, with savings she has, she’s thinking of acquiring more farmland to increase production.

This would be MFP loan #2 so she mentions that she will make her monthly payments problem free.  She also says she’s happy to belong to the “Unión Huanchán” communal bank because of the supportive, responsible work of her fellow members.

She will use the money she’s requesting to buy two bags of pea seeds (1200 soles).  She will use the remaining 800 soles to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is taking out another loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to expand her existing business. With the loan she will be able to purchase some beauty chemicals for her salon, and add stock of wheat flour and rice to her food stall. The previous loan enabled her to increase her monthly income. She aspires to open another business and be able to educate her children. Since the previous loan, her living standards have improved.

loans.use: to purchase some beauty chemicals for her salon, and add stock of wheat flour and rice to her food stall.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema and her children are all well and happy, and the business is coming along well. The last loan was enough to renovate her property. She now wants to start a new business supplying water and selling ice and juice.  She will use the loan to further expand her current businesses. She plans to purchase a refrigerator to boost her ice and juice business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to boost her ice and juice business.

loans.name: Kichuna

texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Kichuna and her charcoal business, which is now progressing well. She would like to take out a new loan to start a new business of selling water. 

She will use the loan to purchase more carts and jerrycans to help transport and supply more water. The previous loan helped with maintenance and growth of the business. The loan also helped subsidize her income, apart from that of teaching. Her goal for the future is to start a new business.

loans.use: to purchase carts and jerry cans.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with 3 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a weaving business. She uses coconut fronds to make roofing materials to sell from her home to her customers. She faces a major challenge of high transport expenses and seasonality. She dreams of starting a shop.

With the Kshs. 40,000 she wants to purchase additional coconut fronds and increase her products. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconut fronds for making roofing materials

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of maize flour, cooking oil and rice for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and bales of maize flour for her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 34-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. For the last six years, he has been running a food stall. He started the stall with 100,000 KES in capital and now has working capital of 4,000,000 KES. He faces hardships like seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Nevertheless, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and expanding to new markets.

Moses needs a loan to buy more food stuffs, such as beans and groundnuts, for sale. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs for sale.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David wants a loan to buy tires for his vehicle .He is 40 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He started as a farmer, saved money and bought a vehicle, which he uses for a transport business. His family dream is to educate his children and buy another car. The responsibility of taking care of three children and wife solely rests on him, since he is the only income earner.

loans.use: buy tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 50 years old and married. She is blessed with two children who are 13 and 12 years old. She has been selling cereals for over 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.  

She is requesting her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase 10 bags of dry maize, two bags of dry beans, and 50 kg of dry cowpeas to sell. 

The profits earned will be used to improve her family's living standards. Her hope is to prosper in business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize, dry beans and dry cowpeas to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Descripción:	La Sra. Olga es de la ciudad de Pilar, es una persona muy trabajadora y lo demuestra día con día con todo el esfuerzo que hace. Ella es comerciante, tiene una despensa con una mercería, en la que trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana.
Olga es madre soltera, tiene un hijo ya adulto, a quien crió con mucho sacrificio gracias a su lucha, gracias a todo ese esfuerzo hoy en día su hijo es una persona honesta y trabajadora.
Olga fue una de las pioneras en su barrio en el negocio de la despensa, y es por eso que tiene muy buena clientela. Pese a los años, su meta es seguir creciendo con su negocio, es por eso que pide este crédito, para poder invertirlo en su negocio, y abastecerlo con azúcar, fideos, arroz, lácteos, panificados y demás insumos. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de la fundación y de Kiva.
texts.en: Olga comes from the town of Pilar. She is very hardworking, as evinced day after day by all her efforts. She is a shopkeeper: she has a locale she uses as a general store, which she opens for business very early in the morning. Olga is a single mother; she has an adult son whom she raised at the cost of many sacrifices and struggles. Thanks to all her efforts, her son has grown to become an honest and hardworking person. Olga was one of the first in her neighbourhood in having a general store, and thus has a very strong customer base. In spite of her age, her goal is to make her business keep growing, and this is why she asks for this loan. She wishes to invest the funds in her shop and supply it with sugar, pastas, rice, dairy products, bread products and other supplies. She is thankful for the opportunity granted by the field partner and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sugar, pastas, rice, dairy products, bread products and other supplies.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married mother of one child who is attending school.  They live in a rented house that has electricity but no piped water. Her husband is a businessman and Janet has her own cafe business. 

Janet has been operating the business for the last one and a half years; before this she had a salon, that is still running up to now. The biggest challenge she faces to her business is raising the stock, which is also her biggest expenditure. She decided to join Yehu so she could get a loan and expand the business. She would like to use the money from the loan to purchase wheat flour, rice, and also add some chairs to her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, and also add some chairs to her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is taking another loan of 20,000 KES in order to expand her existing business.  With the loan, she plans to purchase charcoal to stock and sell.  Since the previous loan, her living standards have improved and her monthly income has increased by more than fifty percent. 

She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a juice blender for making fruit juices to sell and also to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Franciscah

texts.en:
Franciscah is a married woman with one child, who attends school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not running water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past two years, Franciscah has operated a retail shop, selling food stuff like sugar, flour, rice and other basis amenities like soap to her neighbors and passersby.  The major challenge she faces is the high cost of transportation.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 KES she wants to purchase maize flour and a variety of cereals for resale.  She decided to join Yehu in order to gain access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour and cereals for her retail shop.

loans.name: Rosset

texts.en: Rosset is a 40-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been in the hotel business for ten years, and she now earns a minimum of 400,000 shillings daily.  Her hardship is customers not paying on time.  Her personal goals are educating her children and improving her business.  Her business goal is expanding her business into new markets.  Rosset wants money to buy chairs for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for her transport business. She is a 28-year-old hardworking woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her two children since her husband has resorted to daily drinking. Her desire is to build a permanent house, educate her children and expand her business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, de 57 años de edad, reside en casa de su propiedad junto con su hija e hijo los cuales ya son mayores de edad y ayudan en el negocio. Ella se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras de manera ambulante en las diferentes áreas de la zona donde habita. Posee dos vehículos, los cuales utiliza para transportarse y realizar la venta, va pregonando con aparato de sonido (megafono) por calles y pasajes ofreciendo sus productos. Tiene 25 años de dedicarse a esta actividad razón por la cual tiene mucha experiencia y es muy conocida en la zona, además tiene algunos clientes fijos que la prefieren por ser una mujer trabajadora, luchadora y honesta. Lo mejor de todo es que ella siempre mantiene variedad de frutas en las mejores condiciones y a los mejores precios.  Su sueño es mantener su negocio activo por mucho más tiempo ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos y es como ha podido alimentarlos y educarlos. Como toda una mujer emprendedora  ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en variedad de verduras y frutas frescas al por mayor, ya que desea incrementar su inventario para cubrir una mayor demanda de clientes e incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos, de tal forma que esto le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus dos hijos que se dedican a la misma actividad en el segundo vehículo.
texts.en: Jesus, 57 years old, lives in his own house with his daughter and son who are now adults and help with the business. He sells fruits and vegetables for a living as a street vendor in different areas in the zone where she lives. He owns two vehicles, which he uses to transport himself and make sales. He sell his products in the streets and sidewalks using a megaphone. He has 25 years in this field, which is why he has a lot of experience and is well known in the zone. Additionally he has some steady clients that prefer him for being a hardworking man, fighter and honest. The best of all is that he always maintains a variety of fruits and the best conditions and at the best prices. His dream is to keep his business active for much more time since it is his principal source of income and it is how he had been able to feed and educate his children. Like other entrepreneurial men, he has made the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL in order to invest in the purchase of a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables in bulk, as he wants to increase his inventory to cover a larger market demand from clients which allows him to increase his sales and income, and in this way allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his two children who work in the same business with the second vehiculo.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables and fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Sherley Yadira

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Shirley, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 18 y de 2 años de edad, el mayor estudian en universidad. El marido es mecánico.
 
Ella es Lic. En Ciencias De La Educación y trabaja como maestra en un colegio de una parroquia del cantón pero también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y  productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja todos los días ya que ella les vende a sus compañeras y madres de familia en el centro de estudios y los fines de semana recorre por su localidad vendiendo a sus conocidos y vecinos que son sus clientes, lleva 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida familiar y profesional.
texts.en:
The "Banco Comunal Parque a La Madre" gets together every fifteen days in the canton of Jipijapa, a canton known as the "sultan of coffee" for its extensive production of coffee with incomparable flavor, for its gastronomy, and for the warmth of its residents.

This is where Sherley lives.  She is 36 years old, she is married by common law, she has two children (one is 18 years old and the other is 2 years old), and her oldest child studies in the university.  Her husband is a mechanic.

Sherley has a degree in educational sciences and she is a teacher in a parochial school, but she also sells clothing and Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories.)  She sells door-to-door and works every day. She sells to her friends and mothers of the children that attend her school, and every weekend she travels throughout her region selling to acquaintances and neighbors, who are now her customers.  She has been doing this for 12 years and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and clothing of all styles.  She got her start in the Banco Comunal, which gave her one of the loans to start her business.

Sherley dreams to get ahead in her business and in her personal and professional life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Rocio Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 3 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rocio, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  22, 18 y 8 años de edad, los dos menores  estudian en universidad y escuela, todos sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo se comerciante.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella recorre  tres o cuatro días por semana y no tiene horas fijas para vender, puede ser en las mañanas o en las tardes dependiendo de sus clientes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a la venta de Yanbal en cuanto a la ropa recién con el crédito anterior empezó y le está yendo bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva 13 años  en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y cumplidas.
 
Su sueño es llegar a tener una boutique o un bazar.
texts.en:
The “3 de Mayo” (May 3rd) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the “Sultana del Café” for its extensive plantations of incomparably flavored coffee, for its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

We met Rocío, 38, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 22, 28 and 8 years of age.  The two younger ones attend university and school.  All her children still live with her. Her husband’s a merchant.
 
She is a housewife who in order to earn her own income and with it help her husband with household expenses sells clothes via catalogue and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She sells door to door three or four days a week with no fixed work schedule, it can be mornings or evenings depending on her customers.  She sells on credit and collects payments weekly.  She’s been selling Yanbal for four years and clothes just recently; she started it with her previous loan and is doing quite well.  This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.  

She’s been in the communal bank for 13 years and is the group secretary; she likes it because her fellow members are very united and meet their responsibilities.  Her dream is to manage to have a boutique or a store.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina tiene 35 años, vive con Ángel, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 18, 14 y 3 años. La casa donde viven es propia y se ubica en el distrito de Huasahuasi en Tarma.

Ella sale adelante con la actividad que desde niña le enseñaron, la agricultura. Esta actividad es su principal soporte económico y con la que espera lograr sus objetivos. Desde hace 15 años comenzó a sembrar papa y arvejas y con el tiempo aprendió a cultivar maíz, habas y algunas hortalizas. Ángel, su esposo, la apoya en estas labores; para ello utiliza terrenos de su propiedad y otros que arrienda.  Cada vez que cosecha ofrece sus productos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. “El problema es llegar hasta las chacras porque están muy lejos y nos demoramos dos horas para llegar”, señalando lo accidentado del relieve de su zona como principal dificultad. Pero ella no se da por vencida y continua trabajando. Gracias a esta actividad puede educar a sus hijos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Éste es su segundo crédito con MFP. Hace un año y medio que forma parte del banco comunal “Unión Huanchan” y le grada el trabajo que realizan.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá comprar una bolsa de semilla de arvejas, que son 600 soles y tres bolsas de fertilizantes de 120 soles cada una.
texts.en:
Delfina, 35, lives with Ángel with whom she has three children who are 18, 14 and 3 years old.  They own the house they live in and it’s located in Huasahuasi District in Tarma.

She gets ahead with the activity she was taught as a little girl: agriculture.  This activity is her main economic support by means of which she hopes to reach her objectives.  Fifteen years ago she started to plant potatoes and peas and in time learned how to grow corn, lima beans and some greens.  

Ángel, her husband, helps her with her tasks.  She uses both her own fields and others she leases to do her work.  Every time she harvests she sells her products in the city’s wholesale market.  “The problem is getting to the fields because they are very far away and it takes two hours to reach them,” she indicates. The rough terrain in her area is the main difficulty.  But she does not give up and continues to work.  Thanks to this activity she’s able to educate her children and have a better quality of life.

This is her second MFP loan. She’s been a member of “Unión Huachán” communal bank for a year and a half and she likes the work they do.  She will use the money she’s requesting to buy a bag of pea seeds that costs 600 soles and three sacks of fertilizer at 120 soles each.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 50 years old and married with six children. He takes care of seven relatives. He owns a technical business repairing radios, televisions, etc.  He has been in this business for ten years. His business is open from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day each week. 

Bernard has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more materials to repair radios, televisions, etc. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more materials to repair radios, televisions, etc.

loans.name: Wilfredo Jr.

texts.en:
Wilfredo Jr. is 26 years old and single. He is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Wilfredo Jr. has a restaurant in the Philippines. Wilfredo Jr. requested a loan of PHP 29,500 amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for his restaurant.

Wilfredo Jr. has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Wilfredo Jr. would like to save money to expand his business.

NWTF give also an opportunity to men to become a member and engage in business to have a change to improved their lives.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for his business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 42 years old and has three children. Julieta is married and all of her children are in school.

Julieta is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Julieta has been raising livestock for seven years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money to send her children in college.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis de 40 años es una mujer muy trabajadora que tiene un restaurante y estadero familiar, con el que genera ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de sus 3 hijos en las edades de 15 a 21 años. Su negocio está ubicado cerca al escenario deportivo  futbolístico, donde se practica el futbol profesional colombiano y es la sede del equipo Junior de la ciudad de Barranquilla. En el vende comidas corrientes, desde las 6,00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 00 pm. De lunes a viernes, a clientes vecinos de su barrio, peatones  y obreros de la construcción, a quienes les vende contado y a crédito. Igualmente los fines de semanas tiene un estadero familiar, donde vende cervezas y licores también a esa clientela doméstica, que ha construido poco a poco y que hoy la reconocen y le compran cada vez más. Ante la demanda en su mercado, su dinero no es suficiente para responder a las necesidades de sus clientes, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos para la preparación de alimentos, refrescos y bebidas, para aprovechas la celebraciones venideras, como los días del padre, de la madre y de la secretaria. Con su credikiva aumentará su capacidad de compra, tendrá un inventario de los productos que rotan mas rápidamente en su negocio y aumentará su capital de trabajo, que es lo que requiere Denis para poco a poco ver cumplir su sueño de progresar mucho mas, porque en la actualidad posee casa, vehículo y microempresa para continuar su ascenso .
texts.en: Denis is 40 years old and a very hardworking woman who has a family restaurant and tavern, which generates income that goes towards supporting her 3 sons, aged 15 to 21. Her business is located near a Colombian professional football stadium, which is the home stadium of Junior, the team of the city of Barranquilla. She sells ordinary meals from 6 am to 3 pm. From Monday to Friday, her customers are mainly people from the neighbourhood, passersby and construction workers, who buy with ready cash or have a tab. On weekends, her locale becomes a family tavern, where she sells beers and other alcohol to this neighbourhood clientele, which has been built over the years. They know her by now and they frequent her establishment more and more. This growing demand in her market is proving to be to much for Denis's resources: she cannot match the needs of her customers and thus asks for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the funds to buy ingredients to prepare food, beverages and fresh drinks in order to be ready for the coming festivities, such as Mother's Day, Father's Day, and Secretary's Day. With the loan, she will be able to buy more supplies, make larger stocks of the products that are the most in demand, and increase her working capital. This is what Denis needs to slowly see her dream of advancing in life come true, since she owns a house, a car and a small business with which to continue improving her life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food, beverages and fresh drinks.

loans.name: Miler

texts.es:
Miler tiene 43 años, vive con Eva, con quien tiene tres hijos; de 15, 10 y 3 años. La casa donde viven es propia, en el distrito de Huasahuasi en Tarma.

Desde muy niño sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, le gustaba ver como crecían y maduraban su productos. Su experiencia, de más de 20 años en la agricultura, le ayudó a conseguir muchas cosas; como su casa en la que hoy vive, muebles, artefactos, así como la educación para sus hijos.  Ahora se dedica a la siembra de papa, habas, maíz y arveja en varios terrenos de su localidad. Ahí es donde pasa la mayor parte del día, ya que tiene que cuidar su cosecha de las plagas que en este tiempo están atacando su siembra. Miler necesita de capital, ya que este mes inicia la campaña grande de arvejas. “En esta temporada se gana bien de las ventas”, comenta. Él agradece el apoyo de su banco comunal, ya que le enseñaron a seguir adelante a pesar de las dificultades. 

Éste es su crédito número 6 con MFP. Se siente a gusto dentro de su banco comunal “Unión Huanchán”, porque los socios son solidarios y responsables con los pagos.
Miles invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de cuatro bolsas de semillas de arvejas (de 550 soles cada una). Lo restante lo destinará para la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Miler, 43, lives with Eva and they have three children who are 15, 10 and 3 years old.  He owns the house they live in and it’s in Huasahuasi District in Tarma.

Since he was a child his parents taught him to work the land.  He liked to see how the crops crew and matured.  His more than 20 years’ experience in agriculture has brought him many things: the house he now lives in, furniture, appliances as well as his children’s education.  

Now, he plants corn, potatoes, lima beans and peas on several parcels in his locality.  That’s where he spends most of his day since he has to protect his crops from infestations that are currently attacking his plants.  

Miler needs capital because this month the big pea season starts.  “In this season, profits from sales are large,” he comments.  He’s grateful for the support in his communal bank because they taught him to continue forward despite difficulties.

This is MFP loan #6.  He feels good in his “Unión Huanchán” communal bank because the members are mutually supportive and responsible with their payments.

Miler will invest the money he’s requesting in the purchase of four bags of pea seeds (at 550 soles each).  He will use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children. She works hard to support her family. Dioscora has a food vending of fertilized duck egg business in the Philippines. Dioscora requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional tray of duck eggs for her business.

Dioscora has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Dioscora would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional tray of duck eggs to sell

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 36-years-old and is married with one child who is 2-years-old. He also takes care of 2 relatives aged between 20 and 24 years old. He sells meat and he has been in this business for 21 years. His business is open from 7 a.m to 5 p.m every day per week. 

Jean Baptiste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a large quantities of meat for re-sale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of meat for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more clothes in her business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a single man aged 27 years old.  He supports four members of his family.  He has been running a food stall for eight years while earning a monthly income of KES 7,000.  

He is requesting his second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully.  He wishes to use this loan to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, cowpeas, tea leaves, sugar, and rice for his business.  

The profits that he earns will be put back into his business and repay his loan.  His dream is to expand his current business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, cowpeas, tea leaves, sugar, and rice for his business

loans.name: 03.4.78-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to resell in the future.

Loan is 60 years old and she is married with three children.

Loan is the group leader of the 03.4.78 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, her children are grown up.

In 2011, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Loan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Loan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to resell in the future.

loans.name: 3.14. 154.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mến operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.
Mến is 48 years old, and she is married with one child.
Mến is the group leader of the 3.14.154 Thiệu Khánh Solidarity Group, which consists of six members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.
This is Mến first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.
Mến has been involved in this business for eight years.
The main hardship that Mến faces in her business is the lack of capital.
With her business profit, Mến hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.

loans.name: 3.14. 155.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lý works in agriculture, farming food, and has been involved in this business for 8 years. Lý is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children, who are her dependents. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. The main harship she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and later sell.

Lý is the group leader of the "3.14. 155.Thiệu Khánh" solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. This is Lý's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Lý hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 54 years old and married with seven children.

Nena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Nena has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and earns additional income from hawking spices.

Nena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Norma is 45 years old and has two children who are in school. 

Norma has a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines. Norma requested an 11,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. 

Norma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 38 años, vive con el padre de sus 3 hijos (Jordy, Jordan y Wilson). Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo en Tarma. 

Desde los 17 años se dedica a la agricultura. Actualmente siembra maíz, arvejas, habas y papa en sus propios terrenos, los cuales se ubican a media hora caminando desde su casa. A pesar de tener un trabajo sacrificado, lo que más le gusta es el apoyo que recibe de su esposo.”Mi esposo hace el trabajo más pesado, mientras el cosecha yo llevo los productos al mercado”, menciona. 
Julia también compra y vende choclo (maíz tierno). Para ello viaja hasta la ciudad de Lima llevando la mercadería que adquiere en su propia localidad.  Y cuando el negocio no es tan efectivo vende al por menor en el mercado de su ciudad.
Una de sus metas es ampliar su producción de maíz y arvejas, para ello deberá invertir mayor capital. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y éste es su préstamo número 10 con MFP. Se siente gustosa de poder aportar en el desarrollo de su grupo, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Julia destinará los 1500 soles solicitados en la compra de tres bolsas de semillas de arvejas para iniciar con la campaña de este producto.
texts.en:
Julia, 38, lives with the father of her three children (Jordy, Joran and Wilson).  They all live together in her own house located in the Bellavista Huaracayo settlement in Tarma.

She’s been working in agriculture since she was 17 years old.  She currently plants corn, peas, lima beans and potatoes in her own fields located half an hour away from her house.  Despite a demanding job, what she likes best is the support she gets from her husband.  “My husband does the heaviest work; while he harvests, I take the products to market,” she mentions.

Julia also buys and sells choclo (unripe corn).  To do so she goes all the way to the city of Lima and at the same time takes merchandise she gets in her own locality there.  One of her goals is to increase corn and pea production and to do so she must invest more capital.

She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” communal bank and this is MFP loan #10.  She feels happy to be able to contribute to her group’s growth and she also promises to be punctual with her installment payments.

Julia will earmark the 1500 soles requested to buy three bags of pea seeds to start this crop’s planting season.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en: Rodel is married with a child. Rodel is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. Rodel is operating a gardening business to earn a living. He has been doing this for 2 years. Every month he earn 2,500 from this work. He has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Rodel is new to GDMPC. Rodel hopes to double his income from the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She has a fermented fish and salt business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing and tricycle transportation. Julieta is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more salt and fermented fish to sell to customers.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more salt and fermented fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas  is a 34-years-old married man. He has 3 children ranging in age from 3 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be intelligent. He operates a retail stall  where he sells items such as doors, windows, beds, etc. He has been involved in this business for 8 years and employs 2 staff members. 

His business is located at a densely populated area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy metal. His business goal is to be a supplier of metal.

loans.use: to buy metals (raw material).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase various clothing and shoes to sell to the elderly and children

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 29 years old and married. He has been operating a retail shop for one year, giving him an income of KES 8,500.  

He is now requesting his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and intends to purchase two bags of sugar to sell.  

The profits earned from the business will be used for future investments and also to repay his loan.  He hopes to convert his current business to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase two bags of sugar to sell

loans.name: Flossy

texts.en:
Flossy, 37, is married and blessed with three children aged fifteen, thirteen and eleven years old. For the last four years she has run a retail shop, earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

Flossy is now servicing her first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD with which she will buy rice, wheat and maize flour, sugar and tea leaves to sell. She will use her anticipated profits to plow back into her business and repay the loan.

Flossy’s ambition is to develop her shop and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy rice, wheat and maize flour, sugar and tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: United Brothers Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the United Brothers group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businessmen who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to obtain a 5,000,000 SLL loan to be divided equally among the group’s members. With this loan they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits and consequently improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Salieu, aged 32. He was born in Yele in northern Sierra Leone and is married with two children. His wife is a trader, and his children are attending primary and secondary schools.

Salieu sells mobile phone accessories and watches. He has been a businessman for nine years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy mobile phone accessories and wristwatches in bulk to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories and wristwatches in bulk.

loans.name: Heak

texts.en:
Heak is 41 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.  She has been working in a massage shop for over three years, earning approximately $4 per day.  Her husband runs a public transportation service and earns about $5 per day.  And, one of her children is employed in a hotel and earns about $3 per day. 

Due to transportation difficulties, Heak is requesting a loan of $800 in order to purchase a motorbike to commute.  This purchase would enable her to use the money she saves on her transportation for other expenses to support the family.  

In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her commute.

loans.name: Selafia

texts.en: Selafia is 48 years old and married with children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Selafia has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, oil, baking powder and eggs. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Selafia will expand her business.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, oil, baking powder and eggs

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn, 48, is widowed and resides with her two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been employed in a Korean restaurant for more than three years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her children are employed. They earn about USD 6 per day. 

Due to the difficulty with the family’s transportation, Rorn is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate extra income for the family and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, 31, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a chef for more than six years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about USD 7 per day. All of her children are still in her care and in school. 

Due to the difficulty with the family’s transportation, Chan is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, she needs more capital to expand her husband’s business and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Toeurm

texts.en:
Toeurm, 50, is widowed and resides with her five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Four of her children are employed as construction workers. They earn about USD 14 per day. 

Because her present house is too old, Toeurm is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase timber to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child get higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Tioita

texts.en:
Tioita is a 30-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing crops like taro, bananas, and ufi to earn a living. 

Tioita has requested a loan to purchase materials for starting her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Tioita will use her profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Alosia

texts.en:
Alosia is 28 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, salt and consumer needs and wants. She has been doing this for 4 years.

 Alosia needs a loan to buy more items for the store. She hopes to use her profits to improve her home and especially the business. She became a member of SPBD 3 years ago to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for the store

loans.name: Lotutamaiti

texts.en:
Lotutamaiti is a 37-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Lotutamaiti has requested a loan to pay for farming tools. She is a member of SBPD to gain access to financial services. With her profits, Lotutamaiti hopes to improve her home and plan for another business.

loans.use: to purchase farm tools to grow taro

loans.name: Shirly

texts.es: Shirly vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge de actividad taxista y sus dos hijas en las edades de 13 y 15 años. Allí se dedica a la actividad comercia, la cual practica mediante la venta de productos promocionadas con guías especializadas o catálogos y también compra artículos y electrodomésticos menores, que vende mediante el sistema de crédito  a una clientela que ha construido poco a poco y que hoy se encuentra en crecimiento. Su negocio lo inició desde hace 13 años, sugerido por su cuñada; Shrly  empezó vendiendo perfumes, maquillaje y accesorios a través de 2 catálogos, con los que hacia su negociación. Gradualmente ha logrado trabajar con las promociones que impulsa principalmente en cada temporada, como la que se avecina, en la cual hay varias celebraciones: día de las madres, del padre, de la secretaria etc. En su negocio también vende prendas de acero las cuales compra con una frecuencia semanal.  Su meta mas adelante es tener una casa propia y ella y su esposo están empeñados en lograrla, con el fin de ofrecer a sus hijas un mejor estar y propiciarles condiciones para que se conviertan en personas exitosas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancía en promoción, de acuerdo con los artículos que mas se venden en esta temporada y que son: cosméticos,  perfumes, adornos de peluche, electrodomésticos menores etc. La razón de éxito de esta inversión es que la hace en base a su experiencia, a los pedidos que hacen sus clientes y a la temporada que se avecina, en la que usualmente se incrementa el volumen de sus ventas.
texts.en: Shirly lives in the town of Baranquilla with her spouse, who is a cab driver, and her two daughters, aged 13 and 15. She is a retailer: she sells discounted products from catalogues or specialised guides and she also buys small articles and small house appliances that she sells on credit to a customer base that was built over the years and that is now growing. She started her business 13 years ago on the suggestion of her sister-in-law. Shirly started by selling perfumes, make-up and accessories from two catalogues, which were the fundation of her business. Gradually, she managed to work with discount sales that she organises every season, for instance this month on the occasion of Mother's Day, Father's Day, and Secretary's Day. Shirly also sells steel jewellery, of which she buys a new stock once a week. Her goal for the future is to buy a house of her own. She and her husband are very determined to attain this goal in order to give their daughters a better quality of life and help them become successful. Shirly is asking for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy discounted merchandise, particularly articles that sell very well this time of year: cosmetics, perfumes, plushies, small appliances, etc. She is confident that this investment will pay off because of her experience, of the orders placed by her customers and of the coming season, which usually sees an increase in her sales.

loans.use: to buy discounted merchandise, particularly articles that sell very well this time of year: cosmetics, perfumes, plushies, small appliances, etc.

loans.name: Manuel Isaac

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Isaac es soltero, tiene 26 años de edad, se dedica a la artesanía a la elaboración de tejidos. de cortes típicos, inició este negocio gracias al apoyo de su señor padre y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para invertirlo, en la compra de materiales para tejido, consistente en hilos, de varios colores y clases, y mejorar su producción de cortes típicos. En el futuro quiere ver un negocio grande, con capital propio.
texts.en:
Sr. Manuel Isaac is 26 years old, single, and produces woven crafts, such as traditional skirts. He started this business thanks to the help of his Heavenly Father and now he has five years of experience.

Manuel is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of materials for weaving, such as different colors and types of thread, so that he can improve his production of traditional skirts. In the future, he would like to have a larger business and his own capital.

loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha tiene 26 años, vive con Jilmer, con quien tiene un hijo de 5 años, Joseph. Ella y su familia viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Bellavista Huaracayo en Tarma.   

Ella es una mujer agricultora, le gusta el trabajo del campo porque se siente libre y todo lo que obtiene es por su esfuerzo. Siembra arvejas, habas, maíz, papa, verdura y otras hortalizas; pero da prioridad al cultivo de papas y arvejas, pues tiene mayores clientes que le compran sus cosechas, además los precios son buenos y la demanda es constante. 
“Hace 4 años que me dedico a la siembra y sí es rentable, todo depende de la perseverancia y la valentía de arriesgar”, comenta. Todo su trabajo está orientado al progreso de su familia, pues sabe que tiene que forjar un buen futuro para su hijo. 
Mirtha también posee vacas que le proporcionan leche; y toros que utiliza para arar la tierra, por lo que además obtiene un dinero extra cuando los alquila. 
Una de sus metas es comprar sus propios terrenos y así ahorrarse en el arriendo que paga cada vez que quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y en el poco tiempo que lleva como socia, menciona que le agrada el trabajo en grupo. Éste es su crédito número 2 con MFP.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita, Mirtha podrá comprar bolsas de fertilizantes y abonos orgánicos para la siembra de arvejas.
texts.en:
Mirtha, 26, lives with Jilmer with whom she has a five year old son, Joseph.  She and her family live in a rented house located in Bellavista Huaracayo in Tarma.

She is a woman in agriculture.  She likes working in the fields because she feels free and everything she gets is through her own effort.  She plants peas, lima beans, corn, potatoes, vegetables and greens but gives priority to potatoes and peas because she has more customers who buy those crops and besides prices are good and demand is constant.

“I’ve been planting for four years and it’s profitable; everything depends on perseverance and the courage to take risks,” she comments.  All her work is oriented towards her family’s progress because she knows that she has to forge a good future for her son.

Mirtha also owns cows that produce milk and bulls that are used to plow the soil; she earns extra income from them when she leases them out.  One of her goals is to buy her own land to avoid paying rent every time she wants to plant in larger amounts.

She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” communal bank and in the short time she’s been a member she mentions that she likes the teamwork.  This is her MFP loan #2.

Mirtha will use the money she’s requested to buy sacks of fertilizer and organic manure for the pea crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana tiene 54 años, es soltera y vive con su único hijo, Maycon, en su casa propia ubicada en el barrio Bellavista en Tarma. 

Ella supo sacar adelante a su hijo, quien ahora le ayuda en sus labores del campo, actividad que realiza desde que era niña. Por su años de experiencia, ya sabe cómo funciona el negocio, pues los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación logra cultivar le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Su trabajo inicia desde antes que salga el sol, cuidando a sus animales pues también cría cuyes, gallinas, toros y ovejas; luego se dirige a limpiar y a cuidar sus cultivos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender sus cultivos y se siente bien al ver sus arvejas, habas, maíz, papas y hortalizas crecer sanas. “Cuando cosecho vendo mis productos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma”, comenta. Más adelante espera mejorar sus productos para así poder obtener mejores ganancias.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y éste sería su crédito número 5 con MFP. Está dispuesta a pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y colaboradora.
El dinero que ahora solicita podrá invertirlo en la compra de seis bolsas de semillas de arveja, y lo restante será para adquirir fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 54 years old, she is single and lives with her only child, Maycon, in their own home located in the Bellavista neighborhood in Tarma.

She knew how to raise her son, who now helps her with her farm work, an activity she began when she was a child.  Because of her years of experience, she knows how the business runs and how to cultivate her products.  It takes a lot of effort and dedication and has helped her improve her life.  She begins working before sunrise by caring for the animals (she raises guinea pigs, chicken, bulls and sheep). Afterward, she cleans and also cares for her crops.  The activity she most likes in her work is attending to the crops and it makes her feel good to see her peas, beans, corn, potatoes and vegetables growing and healthy.  "I like to sell my products in the wholesale marketplace in Tarma," she says.  Moreover, she hopes to improve her products so that she can increase her income.

She belongs to the community bank “Señor de Muruhuay" and this will be her fifth loan with MFP.  She plans to pay her monthly installments on time.  Her community bank is a very supportive and collaborative partner.

She will invest the money in the purchase of six bags of pea seeds and the rest will be used to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is 26 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling donuts, sausage roll and buns in her community and has been doing this for one year. Epifania has requested a loan to buy new supplies such as flour and sugar for her bakery. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Epifania will expand the business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making baked goods

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a 28 year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells ice cakes (flavored water frozen in cups) in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Susana needs a loan to improve her business. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and family needs. Susana has been a member of Kiva partner SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making ice cakes.

loans.name: Fuarosa

texts.en: Fuarosa is a 41-year-old woman who is married with 9 children. She plans to start a small business, providing a lawn mowing service in the community.  Fuarosa needs a loan to buy a new lawn mower and more spare parts. She will use her profits to expand the business. Fuarosa joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new lawn mower and more spare parts and tools
